Latifa is 50 years old, married, and has many children. She works untiringly to provide sustenance for her family. Her business is a café in a school, where she offers delicious foods for students. She would like to improve her business and stock more merchandise to sell in order to increase her earnings. She is borrowing 70,000 YER from AMB to buy food items for her business. She hopes to own a house.

loans.use: to buy food items for her business

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo is happily living with his wife and three children. He is from a village where most income comes from rice farming. He is thankful to God because even though he didn't finish his studies, he is still able to run his farming business wisely. He aims to have a better and more stable source of income so he can send his three children on to higher levels of education. His goal in life pushes him to work on his farming business. 

Since crop season starts this month, Marcelo is asking for additional working capital amounting to PHP 25,000. He will use this loan to prepare his farm land and to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides. He knows that all these farm supplies are necessary for the improvement of his rice field and will enable him to obtain plentiful harvests in the coming season. Marcelo is hoping for the approval of his requested loan amount so he can move further toward attaining his goal in life.

loans.use: to prepare his farm land and to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en: Jacinto is 29 years of age, married, and has two children. He and his wife work hard in order to earn a living. Jacinto manages his 1.5 hectares of rice fields. He has had this kind of business for six years. He wants to increase his yield so he can earn more income. He knows that crop season starts this month, but he struggles with a shortage of capital. He is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 which will be used to prepare his rice fields and to buy fertilizer and insecticides. Jacinto believes that his hard work and patience will lead him to success, enable him to educate his two children, and provide his family with comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to prepare his rice fields and to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en:
Ameena is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been in the shoe making business for many years. She has the ability to sew the upper part of shoes. The man shown in the photo is Ameena’s husband. Her husband started this work three years before. In this time they have been able to grow their business and make enough to run their household. She has two sons and one daughter. Her daughter currently goes to school. 

In order to cope with the demands of her customers she has requested a loan of Rs.25000 to purchase raw materials such as soles, sheets of leather and plastic leather to prepare winter shoes. This enables her to meet her customers’ demands time after time. 

Ameena wants to provide her children with good quality education.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as soles, sheets of leather and plastic leather to prepare winter shoes

loans.name: Amna

texts.en: Ms Amna is a 50 year old married woman. She has been in the business of making clay pots for the past 15 years with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Amna’s husband. Her husband has expertise in making various sizes and types of pots, while Amna's expertise is painting them. They have gained much popularity in their area. She is a mother of four sons, and three of them currently attend school. Amna wants her sons to get a good education and have good careers in their society. To complete the orders for her business on time she has applied for a loan of Rs. 30000 to purchase stock of good quality clay and packs of paints in various colors. She expects to boost sales which will ultimately help improve her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase stock of good quality clay and packs of paints in various colors

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is a resident of Malindi, Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and a mother of five children. The last born of her children is still in school. Latifa owns rental houses, a business that she has been running for ten years. In addition to this, the family also gets some income from a grocery stall.
She learned about Milango from a friend and joined the institution with the goal of accessing credit in order to improve the operations of her business. The challenge she has been facing is bad debts arising from those who delay on rent payments.
Latifa is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya Shillings to renovate her rental houses. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family. She aspires to own other grocery stalls in the future and to pay for her children’s needs with a little ease.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Ms Irshad is a 26-year-old married woman who has been in the business of sweater weaving for almost six years. She works hard on her weaver every day so that she can earn a living for her family. She has three children. Her husband also makes his living in the same way. There were days when he could not find work and had to return home without money. His heart was heavy with the burden of facing his family’s disappointed faces. Her children often slept without having any food.

When Kashf’s loan officers found her in these circumstances they informed her about micro finance and the services they had to offer. The couple decided to take a loan so that she could start her own work. She said she remembered doing this type of work with her mother in her childhood and was hopeful that the work would help them fight poverty. She has requested a loan of RS 25,000 to purchase more bundles of good quality wool in various colors. While speaking to a loan officer at Kashf she said her children have not slept without having a meal ever since she started working on her own. She wishes to use part of the revenue from the weaving business for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of good quality wool in various colors

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 38-year-old married woman who is the mother of five children. For the past seven years, she has been successfully running a small general store in her community. Sajida's husband earns about 2,000 PKR daily which is insufficient to support her family. This is why Sajida started her general store where she offers various daily use goods. She is very good in dealing with her customers.

Sajida is requesting a 20,000 PKR loan to buy sugar and more packs of salt and grains from the market at wholesale rates. She will also use her loan for personal expenses. Her loan would allow her to fully stock her store. Sajida has borrowed previously and has an excellent repayment history.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, and grains

loans.name: Canh

texts.en:
Canh was born in 1958 and is married with three children. One of her children is a student and the other two have their own families. Canh's husband sings traditional songs to make a living and his income is about 4,000,000 VND. Canh makes iron construction materials and raises pigs to earn a living. She earns 8,000,000 VND a month and has worked in these businesses for the past 21 years. Canh's family earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008 and has repaid her previous 9,184,000 VND loan on time. 

Canh  is requesting a 10,080,000 VND loan to buy iron to make construction materials in her workshop. In the future, she hopes to enlarge her workshop.

loans.use: to buy iron to make construction materials in her workshop

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan was born in 1962 and is married with two children who each have their own families. Her husband raises pigs to earn a living and earns about 2,000,000 VND. Loan grows sprouts for a living and earns 3,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 13,000,000 VND per month. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008 and has repaid her previous 9,184,000 VND loan on time.

Loan is requesting a 10,080,000 VND loan to buy seeds to grow sprouts.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow sprouts

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 46-year-old married woman.  She is living in the poor community of Jhang in the south of Punjab with her husband and two children. Her husband, who works in a factory as a laborer, is not able to able to manage his household expenditures efficiently due to a very low salary. At that time they were not in a position to send their children to school for an education. Safia, to deal with the misery, decided to set up a small business where she could  sell vegetables and fruits.  For this purpose she acquired a loan from Kashf Foundation. She marketed her products in the nearby community and was able to get a reasonable number of customers to her shop in a few days. 

By applying a lot of effort and hard work in her business, Safia was able to earn a very good profit out of it. Safia’s husband appreciated her efforts as she was managing the household and business affairs at the same time very efficiently. Her relationship with Kashf Foundation is very strong because she ran her business effectively and throughout the year she paid all the installments within the due time.  Now Safia had requested a loan of Rs 30000 in order to enhance her business further by offering a wide range of fresh vegetables and fruits to her customers. She proudly says that she is now able to send her children to well-known schools for their prosperous future.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 24-year-old lady who is involved in plastic scraps work along with her husband in a room of her small house. She has been in this business for the last sixteen years.  Parveen sells plastic items that she finds in scraps to the nearby markets and people living around her house. She uses all of the income to support her family. 

Parveen is married and has two children, both are getting an education. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the demand for orders she gets from her customers that she buys from plastic scrap dealers. Parveen is currently in her 8th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. Now she wants to expand her business further and intends to buy molding machines.  For this purpose, she needs funds in the amount of Rs 50000. By getting these new machines she will be able to meet orders and also it will create means of increasing revenue so she may be able to build a reliable source of income.

loans.use: to buy molding machines

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a 23-year-old married woman living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a retail shop and also does farming as an additional income source. She decided to venture into business in order to support her husband, who is a peasant. Inadequate capital to meet the high demand is her major challenge, and her dream is to own a wholesale shop. Juliet is requesting for a loan to buy land and a fridge.

loans.use: to buy land and a fridge

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda manages a buy and sell business. She has this business as a primary source of income that provides for her family economically. She has been in this occupation for more than four years and works hard to provide betterment of her family living. 

Nilda is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to buy more bottles to clean and sell for a profitable price. Part of it will be use to buy bananas to sell in the public market. Hopefully, she will achieve her requested loan in order to obtain good income for the educational purposes of her three children.

loans.use: buy bottles to recycle and sell

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Duong was born in 1977. She has two children who are a 14 years and 2 years old. Her husband is an iron worker. His salary is 5,000,000 VND.  Duong sell canes and bamboos to earn a living. She gets 2,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about VND 7,000,000 per month.

Duong has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy bamboos to weave and sell. She always wants to raise her children up well.

loans.use: buy bamboo to weave and sell

loans.name: Shenaz

texts.en:
Shenaz is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of six.  Among them, four is school-going. Her husband operates a donkey cart but his income is insufficient and unpredictable to meet the needs of the family.

In order to support her family well and contribute to the family income, Shenaz is doing a business of buying and selling goats. With the support of Kashf foundation, she has gradually improved her business.  This is her 5th loan cycle.  Currently she has applied for a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase two more small goats. She is hopeful to get a boost in her net income.

loans.use: buy 2 goats

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a 34-year-old lady with two children. One of her sons is shown in the photo standing next to her.  

Amir lives with her mother, as she has been separated from her husband four years ago. She is a brave lady and doing a business of milk sales to fulfill the needs of her children. 

Being a single a parent, Amir needs to bear the everyday expenditures of her children alone. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently, she is in her 4th loan cycle and has requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase another buffalo to grow her sales. She dreams to provide the best quality education to her children for their prosperous future.

loans.use: buy a buffalo

loans.name: Sanam

texts.en:
Sanam is a 22-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been running a beauty parlor for six years. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory, but he is unable to meet their daily expenditures with his low income.  Sanam is contributing a lot to the family income.  Her husband is happy with her business and respects her a lot.  

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Sanam needs to buy more packs of makeup kits, lipsticks and skin care products. For this, she contacted Kashf foundation and applied a loan of Rs 20000. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Samra

texts.en:
Samra is a 21-year-old lady. She lives with her parents due to separation from her husband.  Her brother is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Samra doesn’t want to be a burden on her parents so she is utilizing her skills of hand embroidery in order to contribute to the family income. 

Samra makes beautiful embroidery patterns for the people in her vicinity. She receives many orders on a daily basis for special occasions like weddings, engagements and parties. To meet the orders on time, she needs to purchase more embroidery materials such as packs of sequins, pearls and spools of threads in different colors.  For this she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 25,000. She is hopeful to get an increase in her net income by completing orders on time.

loans.use: buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan was born in 1980. She has two children who currently attend primary and secondary school. Her husband is a driver and gets 7,000,000 VND per month. Loan sells peanuts and seeds to earn a living. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more peanuts and seeds to sell. She wants to use her profit to upgrade her house and to provide her children with good education.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts and seeds to sell

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Ms Kosar is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of seven. She has been in the business of stitching clothes for ten years. Her husband is employed as a driver and he is happy with his hardworking wife. Kosar, together with her husband, manages the household while operating a business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has requested a loan of Rs. 15000 to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and lace etc. With this she will be able to meet the increasing demand for her business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Kosar hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing good quality education to her children through all her hard work with her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and lace etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye fait de l’agriculture maintenant 8 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. Il a intégré l’IMCEC il n’y a pas longtemps afin de pouvoir bénéficier d’un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des semences et des intrants (de l’engrais et du fumier). Il participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille même avec le maigre revenu qu’il a. Se disant que c’est un devoir de nourrir sa famille, il s’améliore dans son activité de maraichage. C’est toujours dans cette lancée qu’il souhaite dans le futur, construire un forage pour avoir plus d’autonomie et bien mener son activité.
texts.en: Abdoulaye has been farming for 8 years now. He is married and a father. He joined UIMCEC not long ago in order to be able to benefit from a loan that would allow him to buy seeds and inputs (fertilizer and manure). He contributes to the daily expenses of the family even with the meagre income that he has. Telling himself that it's a duty to feed his family, he improves himself in his market gardening business. It's still in this domain that in the future he wishes to build a well to have more autonomy and manage his business well.

loans.use: to buy seeds and inputs (fertilizer and manure).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Ashia

texts.en:
Asha is 26 years old, has been married for eight years and has three children from her relationship, all who are in school.
Asha started a business many years ago in order to help her husband with their family's expenses, because what he earned was not enough to cover everything. She has a small food stall in her home where she prepares delicious dishes. She works every day from six in the morning until seven in the evening. She has had her business for three years and it has always done very well because her customers prefer the flavor of her dishes. 

This loan is for buying ingredients for preparing her dishes. 

Asha's goals are to continue moving her business forward and to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes in her food stall.

loans.name: Zuwiya

texts.en:
Zuwiya lives in the Coastal region of Kenya in a suburban area called Likoni. She is married and has three children. She started her business of selling cosmetics and clothes six years ago. She gives thanks to her aunt who sells cosmetic products because one day she told Zuwiya to help her sell them and Zuwiya liked that very much.

At present Zuwiya has become independent with the sale of cosmetics and clothing. The way that she works is to go around to various places in the city offering the products among friends and acquaintances. 

With the loan she plans to buy beauty items like lipstick, eye shadow, perfume, cream, etc, as well as bales of clothing to take advantage of the forthcoming festive season.

loans.use: to buy beauty items like lipstick, eye shadow, perfume, cream, etc, as well as bales of clothing.

loans.name: Meissa

texts.fr: L’emprunteur s’appelle Meissa, il est marié et père de famille. Il loge dans un petit village situé à quelques kilomètres de la ville principale. Il fait du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Il démarre sa journée à 7h et la termine à 22h du soir. C’est un récent client et il est à son tout premier crédit. Il sollicite un prêt de 150000F CFA pour acheter des arachides, du café local, qu’il va revendre dans le quartier. Avec les bénéfices de l’activité, il pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et appuyer à la dépense quotidienne du foyer. Il rêve d’ouvrir une boutique dans l’avenir.
texts.en: The borrower is named Meissa. He is married and a father. He lives in a little town located a few kilometers from the main town. He has been trading for more than 10 years. He starts his day at 7am and finishes it at 10pm at night. This is a recent client and he is on his very first loan. He is requesting a loan of 150,000 FCFA to buy groundnuts and local coffee, which he is going to resell in the neighborhood. With the profits of his business, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family and support the daily expenses of the home. He dreams of opening a shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, coffee and various other products.

loans.name: Jyambere Mugore/gr Group

texts.fr:
Madame Florida est mariée et a 30 ans. Elle a 2 enfants dont le plus âgé a 5 ans et le moins âgé a 3 ans. Aucun enfant ne va à l’école car ils n’ont pas encore atteint l’âge d’aller à l’école. Elle n’a aucune autre personne en sa charge. 
Elle est née au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 5 ans de l’école primaire.
Elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2012 et est au premier cycle de crédit.
Avec ce crédit, elle va acheter les engrais chimiques et paiera la main d’œuvre avec la partie restante.
Elle n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement.
Pour accroitre son activité agricole, elle va utiliser les engrais chimiques et ceci lui permettra d’accroitre la quantité des pommes de terre qu’elle produit. Elle va aussi augmenter la surface cultivable.
Pour son business, elle a l’ambition de devenir une grande agricultrice des pommes de terre dans la région.
Pour sa famille, elle va assurer le bien être de sa famille en payant les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Florida is married and is 30 years old. She has 2 children of whom the oldest is 5 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. Neither child goes to school since they have not yet reached the age to go to school. She has no other dependents.

She was born in Rwanda and her level of education is 5 years of primary school.

She started collaborating with ACB Ltd. in 2012 and is on her first loan cycle.

With this loan, she is going to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for manual labor with the money leftover.

She doesn't expect any difficulties repaying the loan.

To grow her farming business, she is going to use the chemical fertilizers and this will allow her to grow the quantity of potatoes that she produces. She is also going to increase the cultivable area.

For her business, she has the ambition of becoming a great potato farmer in the region.

For her family, she is going to ensure the well-being of her family by paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 25 year old mother who lives alone with her four year old daughter in the Coast Province in Kenya. She is described as a friendly and responsible person who enjoys her work.

She works alone as a street vendor selling clothing. She started this business when she had her daughter and it generates her only income to support, feed and educate her child. This is her third loan request to Yehu and it will be used to purchase bales of clothing for sale, because requests for these items increase during this season and she is able to earn a good income for her daughter and cover household necessities.

Rose’s dream is to have her own shop where she can sell her merchandise and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 20 years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication and marketing skills to retain her customers. She serves people in her community well and has a good relationship with her customers. Her husband also assists her in buying goods from whole-sellers.  

Mumtaz is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide a good education and food for them. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stock of rice and sugar with the packs of oil. She then would be able to meet her customers’ demand time after time. 

Mumtaz is in her sixth loan cycle and is satisfied with the support of Kashf Foundation. Mumtaz is thankful to Kashf for supporting her in her tough times. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and sugar with the packs of oil.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 15 years. She offers various goods of daily use. She is known in her community for providing good quality products. Her husband is an old man who also helps her in running the business.

Najma is a mother of five children. Her two sons are working in power looms. One is going to school. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy stock of cleansing products and packs of beverages. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand every time. She has also started saving to perform the pilgrimage of Hajj. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of cleansing products and packs of beverages.

loans.name: Zainab K.

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Zainab K. She is single, and has two children, ages 5 and 4.  

In 2002, Zainab K. established her jewelry and hand purse business. She began her business because she had the opportunity to go to school, but she refused. After several beatings from her mother to continue her schooling, she stubbornly refused. Her mother decided to train her in her business.  

She proved to be intelligent and hardworking. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 578,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000.  Zainab K. would use the loan to purchase chains - 10 dozen @ Le 280,000 and hand purses, 5 dozen @ Le 40,000. 

In the future, Zainab K. plans to build a house and open a shop. Changes in the cost of goods to meet customer demand is her major challenge. This loan will help her to improve her business, and she hopes to acquire more loans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase chains and hand purses to resell.

loans.name: Hue's Group

texts.en:
Hue was born in 1973. She has two children who are learning in primary school. She and her husband sell noodles to earn a living. She gets 2,500,000 VND a month from it. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy ingredients to make noodles to sell. Her dream is to let her children have good careers.

Other members who are part of Hue's Group are:

Thuy is 44 years old. She has two children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to do her job. 

Thuoc is 53 years old. She has five children. She collects iron scraps and recycles garbage to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to collect more.

Hanh is 39 years old. She has four children. She repairs electrical machines for a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy some more repairing tools.

Nhung is 29 years old. She has three children. She raises chickens for a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy food for chickens.

Ngan is 42 years old. She has four children. She collects iron scraps and recycles garbage to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to collect more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make noodles to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace has tremendous sales skills and knows how to exploit her talents well. For four years she has been in the business of selling used clothing, which has allowed her to generate an income for her family and herself, and paid for her three children's education. At her young age she has a million dreams she hopes to realize through hard work. One of them is to open her own shop, but for the time being she only wants to buy merchandise for this season. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy used clothing of different styles to sell.

loans.use: to buy used clothing of different styles to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña María Elena, siempre cuenta con su esposo quien la apoya y acompaña en todo, ella ha hecho varios cambios en su hogar con apoyo de Afodenic y Kiva, para seguir mejorando las condiciones de su casa solicita nuevamente crédito para la construcción de un cuarto para la comodidad de sus hijos, con el préstamo comprara cemento, arena, bloques, hierro y el pago de la mano de obra gracias a su trabajo como operaria en una empresa podrá ir pagando sus cuotas sin problemas y así poco a poco seguirá haciéndole mejoras a su vivienda ya que de un solo es muy difícil por la situación económica.
texts.en: María Elena can always count on her husband, who supports and agrees with her on everything. She has made a few changes in her house with Afodenic and Kiva’s help, and she is requesting a new loan to keep on making improvements to her house. She wants to build a room for her children’s comfort, and she will use the loan to buy cement, sand, blocks and iron and to pay for labor costs. She is a worker in a company and thanks to this job she will have no problems in repaying her dues. Through this mean she'll be able to fix up her house little by little since doing it all at once is very difficult because of the financial situation.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, blocks and iron and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Señor De Coylloriti Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa ella es conviviente y tiene 57 años y tiene 9 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de maíz, la socia vende maíz al por mayor, la socia también tiene un grifo,la socia en el negocio de venta de maíz ya tiene 30 años y le va muy bien, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de venta de comida y negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing the members of “Señor de Coylloritty”, a Communal Bank located in Cusco district, province and department.

Rosa is a member of this group. She is 57 years old, she live with her life partner and the have 9 children. She runs a retail activity of her own, selling corn that she buys at wholesale price; she also owns a gas station. Rosa has been selling corn for more than 30 years add things are going very well. She works from 8 am to 5 pm and thanks to this activity she succeeds in providing for her children. Rosa dreams of owning a locale where to sell her corn. She is requesting a loan to buy corn at wholesale price.

The other members of the group engage in selling clothes, providing taxi services, selling food and running a grocery store.

Rosa is grateful to those that will help her making her dream come true through this mean, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy corn at wholesale price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric to create costumes.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es:
Maria con 53 años de edad,  originaria de León, pero actualmente vive en Granada, soltera, madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante. Ella Inicio trabajando desde muy joven en la educación  como maestra de primaria y secundaria, después se dedico a la venta de ropa y sandalia de forma ambulante, negocio del cual sobrevive a diario, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su hija, sus expectativas es mantener estable su negocio para ofrecer más  mercadería a sus clientes.
Maria solicita el préstamo para comprar más ropa como, pantalones, camisas y sandalias etc. con el objetivo de satisfacer la demanda de la clientela, sus planes futuros es poder establecer su negocio en su propia casa,  comprar una vitrina para poder exhibir su mercadería.
texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old. A native of León, she currently lives in Granada; she is single and she has 3 grown-up children. She is a retailed. She started working since she was very young, at first as primary and secondary school teacher, to then engaged in selling clothes and sandals as a street vendor. This last activity currently provides her daily bread, but she can also count on her daughter’s support. She hopes to keep on engaging in her activity in order to offer more products to her customers.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy more sandals and more clothes such as trousers and shirts, in order to meet her customers’ requests. In the future she wants to set her activity in her own house and to buy a display cabinet where to present her products.

loans.use: To buy sandals, trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Thohhat Group

texts.en:
This is “Thohhat” group (literal meaning perseverance) consisting of five members. These tribal women came together to help one another in the form of a group to access a loan. They live in a small village on the outskirts of Churachanpur district of Manipur state in the northeastern part of India. 

Hatkhovei is pictured with raised hand. She is 44 years old and is a mother to three daughters and two sons. Her husband is a farmer by profession and owns a large paddy field where he grows rice. He rears 10 cows which help him in ploughing his field, and he sells milk for money. This is how Hatkhovei assisted her husband before she ventured out to do something of her own. Since her children are coming of age and needed more money for their education, clothes and maintenance she wished to take up some income-generating activities in order to supplement the family income.

With Hatkhovei's first loan, she used the loan as a down-payment to purchase traditional wrap-round skirts from the local weavers. She did sell her products but not as efficiently as she would have thought. However, understanding the market and the fashion of the people, she gradually learnt to select better designs to sell and earn more. Some samples of her products can be seen hanging behind the members in the group photograph. She is happy that she has become a role model for her children and above all she is happy that her husband acknowledges all the support she renders towards the futures of her children. She is in a better position to command her business now and to help out two of her group members, who do weaving and would list out a catalogue to weave for them and place an order.

Hatkhovei has dreams and wishes to fulfill. She wishes to buy her husband a tractor machine to help plough his field. She also wishes to see her children grow up to be fine human beings. She longs for a good house to live in.

Hatkhovei needs another loan to continue with her tribal clothing business. With this loan she will buy more traditional wrap-round skirts to supply to the neighbouring states namely Nagaland. With Christmas coming,  demand for such products is very high. 

Likewise her group members too requested another loan to expand their inventory, clothing & food, with the demand of the holidays nearing.

loans.use: to buy traditional wrap-round skirts to sell in neighbouring states, namely Nagaland

loans.name: Laizoma Group

texts.en:
This is LaizomA group consisting of five members. The group members belongs to a tribal community and hail from Churachanpur which is in Manipur state in the Northeastern part of India. In order to support themselves and contribute to the family income, they have formed a group to access a loan.

Hatkim is pictured with raised hand and she is the group leader. She is 59 years old and is a mother to six sons and two daughters. Unfortunately, two of her sons died some years back. All her children go to a private school at the nearby town. Her husband is a full-time pastor at their local church and his meager income could not suffice to support the family. In order to supplement the family income, Hatkim talked with her husband to initiate activities. With the help of some well-wishers, she managed to open a small general store by sacrificing a room in her house. Her initiative made her children very excited and happy at the same time because her children felt the negative impact of living off of charity. Hatkim believes she will do well with her business because her children are so encouraging about the loan.

This will be her first loan and she will use the loan to stock goods in her store to sell, such as basic daily needs: sugar, tea leaves, batteries, soap, cooking oil, etc. She also decided to sell a recharge coupon for mobile users and will use some of the loan to set that up for her customers.

Likewise the rest of the members too need and requested a loan to start with their respective income-generating activities. They all hope that with this loan they may be able to improve their livelihoods and financial needs.

loans.use: To buy sugar, tea leaves, batteries, soap, cooking oil, etc. to sell at her variety store.

loans.name: Aquila Group

texts.en:
Doiting, with raised hand in the group photo, is the profiled borrower. She is 53 years of age and is a mother to seven daughters and three sons. Five of her older daughters have married and now she lives with five children and her husband. Her husband cuts timber and supplies a carpentry workshop. So, her husband spends most of the time in the forest and visits the family on the weekend only. Before she accessed loans along with her older daughters (before they were married), she worked as a daily wage earner to meet the financial needs for the family. She is determined to educate the younger children and very happy that they are doing well with their studies. With her first loan she ventured into selling vegetables as a business. She barely managed to repay her loan. However things changed for the better with her second loan. With great determination, she used her second loan to buy fresh and organic vegetables. 

Now she needs another loan to help her husband as well as for her own business. She will use part of her loan to hire labour to saw the timber logs into planks and the remaining loan to stock vegetables such as mustard leaves, fresh peas and local vegetables grown here in Manipur (sample local vegetables can be seen in the photograph). She will sell these vegetables in the market.

Likewise, the rest of her group members too have requested another loan to stock their inventory. These five hard-working tribal women join hands to help out one another and they are popularly known as AQUILA group. They all live in Churachanpur, in the state of Manipur which is in the Northeastern part of India.

loans.use: To hire labour to saw logs and to stock vegetables such as mustard leaves, fresh peas and special Manipur vegetables.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is 32 years old, married, and has four children who are dependent and attending a primary school. She started her own business many years ago. She sells fast food in a small food stall. Even today, this is how she assists her husband to help with the household expenses. Currently, she sells her food on the corner by her house from Monday to Sunday. She will use this loan to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, sugar, and other ingredients. Her goal is to have a restaurant that is known for typical Kenyan foods.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Lawaridi

texts.en: Lawaridi is 36 years old and has an excellent reputation. She lives with her husband and two children, who study in order to have a better future. Lawaridi owns a store in her home where she sells different types of medicines. She has owned this business for two years and thus it is very stable. Lawaridi is asking for a loan from Kiva partner's, Yehu. This loan will allow her to obtain the money necessary to supply her business and thereby acquire new clients, which is fundamental for her.

loans.use: to increase her stock of medicine.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is from Kenya. She’s 50 years old, married and has three adult children. She lives in a suburban area of Likoni in the municipality of Mombasa.

She started the business of preparing meals and, thanks to her efforts, she can meet her small expenses. She says that her children are working and she gets some contribution from them to boost her income.

She tells us that her scheduled day begins very early because she must go to the market to buy the products she’ll need to make the meals. The greatest difficulty she has is due to her cafe being so small, the space being too small to accommodate many customers at one go. She will use the loan to buy ingredients like basic grains, flour, sugar, food flavorings, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like basic grains, flour, sugar, food flavorings, etc.

loans.name: Myrvete

texts.en:
Myrvete was widowed long ago and is the mother of two children. They all live on the east side of northern Albania, in a little town. “I basically raised the children all on my own, yet have no regrets; they turned out to be very good children and they respect me and appreciate all the sacrifices I have made for them,” Myrvete said. Her children are both grownups now and both have their families, yet one of them lives with Myrvete because this is a family custom that is followed by most families in northern Albania.

Myrvete operates a little store where she has been selling in limited quantities a variety of items from the very beginning such as food, toiletries, clothes, handcrafts, etc. Now she wants to stock up on more quantity of items and this is the reason that she requested this loan of 90,000 Albanian lek.

loans.use: to stock up on more quantity of items for her little store

loans.name: Bat-Otgon

texts.en:
Bat-Otgon is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their recently bought house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. He makes steel frames for buildings and works with three other people as a brigade for 5 years. Bat-Otgon said that working by himself is more profitable compared to working as a worker for a company. His work continues from April to October.

In the winter he doesn’t have a job, so he runs a taxi business. His wife has been working as a cook in fast-food restaurants since 2006. Their children go to the public secondary school.

Bat-Otgon is requesting a loan to make some improvements in their house before moving in. The loan he is taking will be used to replace old wooden windows with double-glazed ones, to paint the walls, to change the wallpaper and to install an electric heating system. By doing this, his family will have a good living condition.

loans.use: to make some improvements in their house

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is 27 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children in the town of Likoni, Kenya. Her family helps with her business.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more women's and children's clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors in the area. She wants to increase her range of stock and she hopes in the future to expand her business by opening a shop since she currently sells door to door.

loans.use: to buy more women's and children's clothes to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a hardworking villager who lives in Albania, is in his early sixties and married. For fifteen years now, he has owned his own land where he has mainly grapevines. 

“I love this activity; I am very passionate about it, and you find me here all day,” he says laughing. “I believe that my passion has been reflecting on the outcome: the income I have been making,” David says.

“I take care of the trees and sell grapes to villagers and other store owners, or individuals who want to make wine. Now, with the loan I am requesting from Kiva, I want to buy grapevine pillars and build an irrigation system,” David continues saying. 

He would be very grateful for any financial support that lenders can provide him.

loans.use: to buy grapevine pillars and build an irrigation system.

loans.name: Toto

texts.en:
Toto, 39, is a married woman who lives with her family in the town of Likoni in a house they own. She sells fried potatoes at the market, and thanks to the profits she gets, she has been able to help with the household expenses.

She learned the business from her sister, since she was in that line of work. Then she decided to become independent. Now she has a small locale with a large clientele, since her products are very well-liked.

Toto informs us that the sector isn’t too dangerous, but there is some crime which does concern her. Her future goal is to have a hotel and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy sacks of raw potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 26 years old. She is a single mother and has one school-age son. 

Her business is selling tea leaves. She normally buys sacks of the commodity and packs the tea leaves in small plastic bags before she sells. She has been in this business since 2009. Grace needs this loan to buy sacks of tea leaves to sell. 

She would like her son to finish his education and to be able to build her own house, since she currently rents the house in which she resides.

loans.use: to buy sacks of tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha lives with her husband and five children, who help her with the business. She has her own business in which she makes dumplings, making them from Monday to Sunday since she has many clients and it is necessary to attend to them in the best possible way. The business is located at the market where it is densely populated.

Mwanasha is requesting a loan with which she can buy a larger quantity of raw materials to make her dumplings. This business is very important to her since it allows her to grow as a person due to the fact that she can rely on her own work, and by working can help her family to have better economic stability and likewise have everything necessary for the home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, baking powder, cooking oil, food flavoring, etc.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Due to the increase in the number of customers over the past few weeks, Bahati is asking for another loan to expand his business. He says it is doing very well, since he does not have stiff competition. 

The previous loan had a great impact on his business and living standards at large. With this new investment, Bahati is sure to have more income to continue educating his children. 

He plans to buy another printing machine. His dream is to see his business flourish and grow more and more.

loans.use: to buy another printing machine.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig is 35 years old and lives with his family in their wooden house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His family consists of five people: Ganzorig's wife, daughter, parents and himself. Ganzorig has been working as a heatline plumber in a government company for twelve years. His wife has been working as a cleaner for a private company since 2011, and his daughter goes to public school. His parents are pensioners and live in the ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, on his plot of land. 

Ganzorig is planning to extend his house in order to give it more square meters and to live together with his parents. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase building materials for his house extension. By doing this, Ganzorig will have a chance to live with his elderly parents who are in need of assistance, and his family will have a more spacious house.

loans.use: to extend his house in order to give it more square meters.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is a visionary man who has the urge to move forward in life and have a prosperous future. 

Recently, he opened a charcoal-selling business which is doing well. He has very many customers, since his charcoal is of high quality, which is why his customers prefer buying from him. 

The previous loan helped him to add stock of vegetables to his vegetable stall, which is currently under the care of his wife. The new loan he is requesting is to buy 50 sacks of charcoal for sale. Thanks to his efforts, he has a big charcoal store.

loans.use: to buy 50 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Orgito

texts.en:
Orgito, a 29-year-old, hard-working Roma man, lives in a major city in central Albania. Orgito is married and has two children, seven and three years old. He has been buying and selling used clothes in the city’s market and also has been offering transportation services to his community, by using a horse. In addition to these activities, he works in odd jobs in his community. He considers himself blessed to have been given such an opportunity in helping his community thrive.

This is the first loan for Orgito, and he wants to stock up on more used items to resell.
 
His only hope for the future is that his children live a better life compared to his, and he will work hard to make this a reality, he said. “This is a promise to my children that I keep it in silence,” Orgit continued saying.

loans.use: To buy more used items to resell

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is taking out a new loan to invest in his retail shop. He says that thanks to the previous loan, which he was able to successfully repay, he was able to save money to open this business. 

With this loan, he will buy stock of basic grains, foodstuffs, cleaning products and basic medicines. In this way, he is very sure he will not only increase the variety to offer his customers, but also increase sales.

loans.use: to buy stock of basic grains, foodstuffs, cleaning products and basic medicines.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 45 years old and currently lives in a rented house, with his family. He owns his welding workshop, where he works repairing vehicles, bicycles, and motorcycles. He wants to expand his business, but he lacks enough working capital to do so. That is why he is asking for a loan in the amount of KES 40,000 to buy a welding machine and soldering wire, among other welding materials. He has been in this business for over 15 years.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine and soldering wire, among other welding materials.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel de treinta años de edad vive junto a su grupo familiar en casa propia; el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Víctor es un hombre dedicado a su labor, enérgico y con muchas metas por delante, su mas grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito es la constancia y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, como todo buen comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Víctor Manuel tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
30-year-old Víctor Manuel lives with his family group in his own home.  He has a shop where he sells basic need products like beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among others.  He has spent many years with his business and this has given him experience in sales that allows him to to get the best earnings.  It is located in his place of residence, in a very busy town, and he has made many customers.  The people prefer him because he always has what they need among quality products, affordable prices, and with unrivaled service he's always at the order of his customers.  Víctor is a man dedicated to his work, energetic, and with many goals ahead.  

His greatest secret to reaching success is the perseverance and love for the job; he knows that only this way he can achieve what he wants, and like all good merchants he wants to increase the business and make a new investment but he needs the capital.  This is why he asks INTEGRAL for a loan that allows him to buy basic grain, sweets, eggs, bread, drinks, etc.  Víctor Manuel has good pay references and he assures that he will settle the debt and at the same time trusts that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, and drinks.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hija; el posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad y también ahora para ampliar el negocio se dedica a la compra y venta de productos, como cremas, perfumes, cosméticos, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia desde su hogar y en forma ambulante se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que venden es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Juan es un   hombre activo, dedicado a su labor y muy luchador todos los días se esfuerza por tratar de cumplir sus sueños sabe que solo con constancia y amor al trabajo podrá alcanzar ese éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda del producto y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, cremas, perfumes, cosméticos etc. Juan Francisco tiene buenas referencias de pago, es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
35-year-old Juan Francisco lives with his life partner and his daughter.  He has a shop where he sells basic need products and, to increase the business, he also now buys and sells products like creams, perfumes, and cosmetics, among others.  He has spent several years with the business and this has given him a lot of experience that allows him to get the best earnings.  He sells from his home and as a street vendor; he has gotten many customers because the people prefer him because all that he sells is of high quality and at affordable prices, in addition to the unrivaled service always at the order of the customers.  Juan is an active man, dedicated to his work, and very hard-working.  Every day he tries his hardest to fulfill his dreams because he knows that only with perseverance and love for the job he will be able to achieve this success. 

 In the last few weeks the demand for products has increased and he wants to recover.  This is why he asks INTEGRAL for a loan that allows him to buy basic grains, instant products, creams, perfumes, cosmetics, etc.  Juan Francisco has good pay references, is very responsible, and assures that he will be able to settle the debt and at the same time has faith that he will be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, intant products, creams, perdumes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 41, lives with his common-law wife in their own house. He runs a clothes business in a very busy area and sells a variety of women's, men's and children's skirts, shirts, dresses and pants. He has been in business several years and has many fixed customers who know his products are top quality, with low prices and good service.

John is an enterprising, visionary person who likes to take advantage of every opportunity he gets in order to become successful. He wants to invest more in his business because of increased demand so as not to disappoint his customers. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Yehu to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.es: María Adela de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa camisas, pantalones, blusas, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en un lugar que califico como bueno para sus actividades comerciales el cual  es muy conocido por las personas del lugar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; María es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor y un gran éxito para el futuro, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor etc. María Adela tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
42-year-old María Adela lives with her life partner and her children in their own home and makes a living by purchasing and selling clothing like shirts, pants, and blouses.  She has spent several years with this business and this has given her a lot of experience that allows her to get the best earnings.  The business is located in a place that qualifies as good for her business activity, which is well-known by the people of the town.  She has gotten many customers since the people know that everything is of good quality, at affordable prices, and with unrivaled service it is always to the order and liking of the customers.  

María is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her work, and very hard-working.  She pushes herself day in and day out in order to earn a better life and a great success for the future.  In the last weeks the demand has increased and she wants to take advantage with a new investment but she does not have enough capital to back it.  This is why she asks INTEGRAL for a loan that allows her to buy wholesale clothing, etc.  María Adela has good pay references and impeccable morals.  She assures that she will be able to settle the debt and at the same time she has the hope that she will bring home financial security.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Maria Arely Trinidad

texts.es: María de 44 años de edad vive junto a su hija de 18 años de edad quien es su única ayuda y la que la acompaña en su vida. María es una madre ejemplar ya que a pesar de las dificultades jama ha decaído y con esfuerzo y sacrificio le ha entregado a su hija lo mejor. Actualmente se siente orgullosa y posee una pequeña tienda ambulante donde  vende artículos de primera necesidad y lo que las personas necesitan como primera opción como: Papel higiénico, shampoo, jabón, galletas entre otros, ella buscar surtir más su pequeña venta y es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito y así poder comprar más artículos como: Huevos, jugos, pastas, sopas, consomé, arroz, frijol etc. Cabe destacar que la cliente posee buenas referencias bancarias esto la hace verse como una mujer responsable y que no le gusta quedar mal con las personas. María busca seguir brindándole un buen bienestar a su hija ya que juntas emprenden un nuevo día y saben que con la ayuda que recibirán pronto su vida podría mejorar.
texts.en: Maria is 44 years old and lives together with her eighteen year old daughter who is her only helper and the one who stays with her in life. Maria is a an exemplary mother who, in spite of difficulties, has never grown weaker and with effort and sacrifice has delivered the best to her daughter. Now she feels proud and has a small store where she sells day-to-day products and other products that people need daily such toilet paper, shampoo, soap, and creackers among other things. She wants to stock more for her small sales, and for this reason she got closer with Apoyo Integral to ask for a loan and to be able to buy articles like eggs, juices, pasta, soups, consommé, rice, beans, etc. It should be noted that this client has good banking references which make her see herself as a responsible woman. She doesn't like to hold grudges with people either. Maria is looking to continue providing a wellbeing to her daughter so that together they can begin a new day, and they know that the help they will soon receive will be able to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy products like eggs, juices, pasta, soup, consommé, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: La Fraternite 3 (3) Group

texts.en:
Clyde, age 37, is engaged to be married and has two children, 2 and 10 years old. His 10-year-old is in school. Clyde is representing the La Fraternité 3 (3) group. He owns and operates a small grocery stand in Brazzaville. He has had this business for five years and has gained the loyalty of his customers. He will use the loan to buy cookies, candy, and soap for his shop. His business strategy is to offer snack food, such as bread with cheese or chocolate. Most customers will buy a small snack while they are shopping. 
Clyde has received one previous loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He wants to build his own boutique in the future. He hopes his children will study and do well in school.

loans.use: to pay for cookies, candy, and soap to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Shaloom 2 (2) Group

texts.en: Ghislain, age 36, is married with 2 children, ages 10 and 13 years. Both of his children are currently attending school. Ghislain is a member of the Shaloom 2 (2) group. He owns a small cafeteria that he has been operating for 2 years. He will use the loan to restock the cafeteria's supply of milk, coffee, and other drinks. His business strategy is to make certain salads that his customers prefer and to provide the most popular cheeses. Ghislain has received 3 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He wants to grow his business using the loans from HOPE. He hopes his children will be healthy and happy in their lives.

loans.use: to pay for milk, coffee, and drinks.

loans.name: Jingvalpa Group

texts.en:
This is Jingvalpa group, consisting of 13 members. The term Jingvalpa means "Morning Star." These 13 hard working women belong to a tribal community. They hail from a small, remote village in Manipur in the northeastern part of India, about a four-hour drive from the state capital, Imphal. 

Hatchaneo is the member pictured with raised hand. She is 45 years old and is a mother of two sons and a daughter. The children walk to a private school that is about one and half kilometers away. She never had the opportunity to go to school but as parents, she and her husband try their utmost effort to provide good education for the children. She means to enroll her oldest daughter in a nursing institute in the state next year. In order to reduce financial worries, she has been trying her luck from one trade to another.

With her first loan back in 2009, she managed to buy king chillies weighing 3 tons, which is equivalent to 1200 kilograms. She, along with her children, dried the chillies to repack for sale. The dried chillies can be preserved for a very long time. In this way, she has been selling chillies and managing the financial problems of the family. She is happy that her business has paid for the children's education.

Now she needs another loan to increase her business. The chilli plantation is usually harvested during the winter season. She will use most of the loan to buy more green raw chillies to dry and then sell for more profits once the chillies season ends and the selling price increases. She will use the lesser amount or about one-third of the loan for consumption purposes such as to buy new clothes for the children for Christmas.

Likewise, rest of the group members have been struggling to do good with their respective income generating activities. Poultry farming, pig rearing, meat selling, grocery store, retailing business, tea stall, etc., are some of the highlights of the members activities.

loans.use: To buy green chillies to dry and sell later and to purchase new winter clothes for the children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her vehicle's legal papers

loans.name: Lucio Erasmo

texts.es: Don Lucio Erasmo tiene 40 años, nació  en los Andes  del departamento de la Paz, estudio hasta tercero básico, desde niño ayudo a sus padres en la agricultura, tiene bastante experiencia el rubro hace 4 años que se dedica a la avicultura con el apoyo de su pareja y de sus hijos, en el sindicato que pertenece conformaron un grupo todas las personas que se dedican a la avicultura para fortalecer y poder buscar ayuda para la infraestructura de un matadero para el faeneo de los pollos, así ellos podrán sacar sus pollos y llevar directo al matadero para su posterior comercialización,  la venta de pollos es local y la competencia es variada y creciente generalmente es de la ciudad de Santa Cruz que ingresa pollos PIO RICO que es su mayor competencia, este año don Erasmos ha incrementado la producción de los pollos, necesita un préstamo para comprar alimento balanceado de engorde.
texts.en: Lucio Erasmo is 40 years old, was born in the Paz region of the Andes, and studied up to third grade. Since he was a boy, he helped his parents in agriculture. He has a lot of experience in the rubric. For the past four years he has dedicated himself to agriculture with the support of his partner and his children. In the union which belongs to the area, they formed a group of all the people dedicated to agriculture to strengthen and to be able to look for help for infrastructure of the slaughterhouse for the chicken farmers. This way they will take chickens and carry them directly to the slaughterhouse to sell them later. The chicken are sold locally and the competition varies and generally grows from the city of Santa Cruz, who invest in chicken from the brand Pio Rico, which is his highest competition. This year Lucio Erasmo has increased the production of the chicken. He needs to loan to buy animal food to fatten them.

loans.use: to purchase animal food to fatten hens.

loans.name: Margarita Del Rosario

texts.es: Margarita de 44 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus dos hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace varios años. La tienda está ubicada en su hogar de residencia la cual ha sabido adecuar de tal forma que llame la atención de los clientes, además vende tortillas eso como un ingreso más para su familia y las vende en horas de almuerzo y x la tarde noche .  Sus vecinos dan buenas referencias tanto de su trabajo como de su persona. Es muy conocida y preferida ya que es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora la cual ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos quienes ven como ella se ha superado día a día. Margarita desea ampliar más su negocio es por esta razón que se decidió en hacer este préstamo con el fin de incrementar su inventario .El crédito que solicita a INTEGRAL es para comprar variedad de productos de tienda tales como: maíz, arroz, aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, golosinas, bebidas, macarrones, sopas, etc. ya que desea cubrir una mayor demanda de mercado que le permita incrementar sus ingresos de tal forma que pueda ofrecer a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Margarita is 44 years old, lives with her two children in a house that she owns, and has made a living as a shop merchant for several years.  The shop is located in her home which has been adapted in such a way that it gets the attention of the customers.  In addition she sells tortillas, which serves as more income for her family, and she sells them during lunch hour and in the evening.  Her neighbors give as many good references for her work as for her character.  She is well-known and preferred because she is a kind and hard-working woman who has managed to gain the trust of her neighbors who see how she has improved from day to day. 

 Margarita wants to further increase her business and for this reason she has decided to get this loan in order to increase her inventory.  The loan that she has requested from INTEGRAL is to buy a variety of store products like corn, rice, oil, sugar, beans, sweets, drinks, macaroni, soup, etc because she wants to cover a larger demand for merchandise that allows her to increase her income in such a way that she can offer her family better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for her shop like corn, rice, oil, sugar, beans, sweets, drinks, macaroni, soup, etc.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.en:
For 22 years, Gilberto operated O. Real Estate & Tax Service in Lubbock, Texas.  He moved to San Antonio in 2008 where he continues his work as a real estate broker and tax preparer. 

Currently, Gilberto has one employee, his son, who is learning his father’s tax preparation and real estate sales trade. 

Though there are many tax preparation services in San Antonio, some only a couple of miles from his own office, Gilberto says his two decades of experience sets him apart from others.

Gilberto graduated from Texas Tech University with a business degree in 1968. Upon graduation he worked for Montgomery Ward, then as a car salesman, and later as a door-to-door salesman.

After attending a tax preparation seminar at H&R Block where he learned to prepare taxes, he began doing his and his family’s taxes and received his license from the IRS to prepare taxes. From there, Gilberto decided to open his own business. "I wanted to be on my own. I didn’t want to be working for somebody else," he said. 

This is Gilberto’s second Accion Texas loan. He plans to use it for working capital, mortgage payments and payroll expenses until tax season. "Without the loan, I would have run out of money unless I made a quick commission, but I don’t have any pending contracts and need to pay utilities, my employee, and mortgage payments for my business," he said.

The loan will help Gilberto’s business for the upcoming months, but his next step is to work with his son on establishing a website after 2013’s tax season.

loans.use: to meet his payroll, pay his mortgage and have working capital until tax season.

loans.name: La Fraternite 3 (1) Group

texts.en:
Daniel, age 29, is married with two children ages 1 and 10 years old. His 10 year old is currently going to school. Daniel is representing the La Fraternite 3 (1) group. He owns a small grocery shop in a local market. He has had this business for three years. He will use the loan to buy merchandise for his shop, including cans of sardines, sugar, oil, and milk. His business strategy is to buy a variety of things to stock his shelves. He wants to provide many options for his customers. 
Daniel has received two previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He wants to continue to expand his business and grow his profits. Daniel hopes his family will have money to provide for their needs and be prosperous. He would like his children to be able to travel.

loans.use: to pay for products for his grocery stand, including cans of sardines, sugar, oil, and milk.

loans.name: La Fraternite 3 (2) Group

texts.en:
Jean, age 32, is single with a four year old little girl. He is representing the La Fraternite 3 (2) group. He has a small grocery shop in a local market. He has had this business for three years. He plans to use the loan to buy cans of sardines, sugar, oil, milk, soap, and toilet paper. 
Jean has received one previous loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He wants to continue to expand his business through the loans from HOPE. Jean hopes to give his little girl a good life and wants his family to be healthy.

loans.use: to pay for cans of sardines, sugar, oil, milk, soap, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Shaloom 2 (1) Group

texts.en: Edith, age 46, is a single mother of four children, 8 to 24 years old. She has two children currently attending school. Edith also cares for ten orphans in her community. Every day they come to her house, and she feeds them a meal. Edith has compassion for these children and is always searching for clothes for them. Edith is representing the Shaloom 2 (1) group. She has a stand in the local market where she sells food products. She will use the loan to buy palm oil, sugar, and rice. She has been selling in the market for ten years. Her business strategy is to offer her customers good service. She realizes how important it is to be friendly and helpful with her customers. Edith has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to continue to grow her business and make larger profits.

loans.use: to pay for palm oil, sugar, and rice to sell in the market.

loans.name: Source De Vie 1 Group

texts.en: Laudra, age 33, is married with no children, but she provides for her niece. She is a member of the Source de Vie 1 group. Laudra owns a butcher shop that she has been operating for 3 years. She plans to use the loan to buy chicken and beef to stock her shop. Her business strategy is to reduce the price for customers who buy in large amounts. This practice encourages customers to return and to buy from her for large events. Laudra has received 4 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She wants to continue to grow her butcher shop and build a large boutique and counter. She would also like to have a large walk-in freezer one day. Laudra wishes for her niece to grow up and help her to run this business.

loans.use: to pay for chicken and beef.

loans.name: Source De Vie 2 Group

texts.en: Christian, age 35, is married and has two children, 8 and 12 years old. Both are attending school. He also provides for his nephew. Christian is representing the Source de Vie 2 group. He owns an office-supply business and has been in business for around one year. He will use the loan to add to his business's stock, including notebooks, computer paper, and ink cartridges. His business strategy is to offer to go to his customer's place of business, take orders, and deliver the merchandise. Many business owners prefer this, because they do not have to leave their businesses to get supplies. Christian wants to continue to grow his business and eventually to begin importing some merchandise. He wants his children to continue to go to school and live in good conditions.

loans.use: to pay for notebooks, computer paper, and ink cartridges to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Prosperite 1 Group

texts.en: Laurent, age 56, is married and has five children, from 20 to 28 years old. All five of his children are currently attending school or university. He also cares for his niece. Laurent is representing the Prosperité 1 group. He sells car parts and oil from a shop in his community. He has been running this business for three years. He will use the loan to add to his stock of car parts and motor oil. His business strategy is to market his business in the community. He knows it is important for people to be aware of his business and what he has to offer. He has received four previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner, and he has a good repayment record. Laurent wants to continue to grow and develop his business. He hopes his children will find jobs and work and be successful.

loans.use: to add to the stock of car parts and motor oil at his shop.

loans.name: Prosperite 4 Group

texts.en: Felicite, age 53, is the single mother of four children, ages 20 to 29 years old. She has one child currently attending school. She is representing the Prosperite 4 group. Felicite sells manioc and firewood at a stall in a local market. She has been selling for over 20 years! Over the years she has gained a good reputation in the community and loyal customers. She will use the loan to buy more manioc and firewood to sell. Manioc is a very popular Congolese food that is made from the roots of the local cassava plants. It is a white color with a corn meal consistency. Her business strategy is to give a small gift of wood or manioc to her customers so that they will return next time. Felicite has received four previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner, and she has a good repayment record.

loans.use: to pay for manioc and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood from the "Diablo Fuerte" brand which he needs to perform his work.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena, vive junto a su familia su esposo y su hija, gracias a Dios viven en casa propia ya que con esfuerzo han hecho que poco a poco su calidad de vida mejore un poco más.  Es un mujer luchadora que sus visiones siempre han sido  darlo todo por el bienestar de su hija es responsable, honesta, sincera y trabajadora es muy amable y eso a ella le llena de orgullo ser una buena madre y esposa. Magdalena posee una pequeña tienda donde vende artículos básicos y de primera necesidad como leche, huevos, papel higiénico u otros. La tienda está ubicada en su casa y gracias a la manera de atender a los clientes ella posee de clientela quienes son los que la buscan para comprarles productos a diario. Ella no tiene el capital necesario para hacer que su tienda crezca un poco y es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de más artículos como: Sopas, café, maíz, frijol, Huevos, leche, pan dulce, chocolate u otros.
