Carmen’s dream is to be able to start building their rooms on a piece of land that she has.  This will improve her quality of life.

The is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stucco, paint, and others to put the finishing touches on the rooms where they live.

loans.name: El Terrenito De La Cebolla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario esta conformado por tres personas, las cuales a base de sacrificio y mucho trabajo estan logrando construir sus sueños y mejorando la calidad de vida de sus Familias.
Es por ello que solicitan el presente credito para comprar semilla de cebolla de buena calidad para mejorar su produccion y ademas sembrar en otro terrenito que tienen para poder lograr que su produccion sea mayor que la de otras veces y obtener mejores ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

La señora que se encuentra en la foto, con vestimenta de color verde y falda ploma,no es miembro del grupo solidario es la madre del presidente el Sr Jose, la cual brinda su ayuda en las tareas de la agricultura junto a su hijo.

Este grupo solidario tiene como presidente al Sr. Jose el cual se define como una persona muy trabajadora, humilde, responsable y con infinito amor hacia su familia y sus semejantes, es por estos atributos que Jose, se ah hecho merecedor al aprecio de sus coterraneos.

El sueño que Jose tiene es logar a ser un productor de cebolla muy importante, tener un terreno muy grande donde el pueda sembrar y cosechar su propia cebolla de buena calidad, y con estos ingresos darles a sus hijos la educacion universitaria.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three people who strive to fulfill their dreams and improve their families’ quality of life through hard work and sacrifice.  It is for this reason that they are requesting this current loan.  They will buy onion seeds of good quality so that they can improve production.  In addition, they will begin planting on another small plot of land so that they can achieve the largest harvest they have ever had.  This will enable them to generate more income so that they can satisfy the needs of their families.  

The woman who appears in the photo with a green vest and silver colored skirt is not a member of the solidarity group; she is the mother of Sr. Jose and helps her son with his agriculture business. The solidarity group president is Sr. Jose.  He defines himself as a hardworking, humble, and responsible person who has the unending love of his family and neighbors.  These attributes are the reason why Jose is greatly admired by his compatriots.  

Jose’s dream is to become a major onion producer.  He hopes to have a large piece of land where he can plant and harvest his own onion crops that are of good quality.  Jose would use the earnings to provide a college education for his children.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds.

loans.name: Eufemia Dolores

texts.es:
Hasta hace pocos el sector sur de la ciudad de Quito, no era tomado en cuenta dentro de los sectores económicos fuertes de la capital de la República del Ecuador, ahora este sector es considerado una fuerza de la economía de la ciudad. En este lugar se encuentran familias emprendedoras que han luchado para sobresalir. Entre nativos y migrantes de otras ciudades y países, ha sido el punto de encuentro de habitantes de varias provincias, y está reconstruido con extensas calles. Eufemia reside en el sector  de Chimbacalle, en la ferroviaria baja, un barrio ubicado en el sector sur de la ciudad, un sector con una alta actividad comercial que es cada vez más fortalecida y que aporta en gran manera al crecimiento económico de la ciudad. Se destaca en esta zona los parques con amplias zonas verdes en los cuales se dan cita las familias los fines de semana. Hay gran accesibilidad a todo tipo de servicios y sus habitantes son emprendedores que aprovechan cada oportunidad que se presenta con establecimiento de nuevos negocios. Los migrantes de varias provincias del país residen en este sector y ponen a prueba sus habilidades y destrezas para salir adelante con la puesta en marcha de negocios que son establecidos empíricamente en su mayoría. 
Eufemia es una mujer de 60 años, trabajadora que nunca ha dejado de luchar por conseguir sus sueños, terminó el colegio y luego se dedicó a trabajar porque la situación económica en su hogar no le podía proveer los estudios superiores. Siendo joven se casó y tuvo 3 hijos que ahora son adultos Edison de 42 años, Patricio de 40 y Juan Carlos de 32. Eufemia ahora está divorciada y vive sola, pero considera que independientemente de su situación puede salir adelante y la prueba de eso es que hace 4 años abrió un lugar pequeño en el cual vende comida rápida y tradicional que era muy demandada en el lugar por estudiantes, vecinos y trabajadores del sector. Esta actividad le ha ayudado a tener una estabilidad económica y además puede disfrutar en sus tiempos libres de sus familiares. En ocho horas del día, Eufemia asea los alimentos, los prepara y atiende a cada cliente que llega. Ahora con la experiencia que ha adquirido está segura de que puede hacer crecer su negocio, por lo que acudió a Fundación Alternativa quien a través de Kiva, le otorgan un crédito para que ella compre mercadería como golosinas o productos de consumo inmediato que se puedan combinar o complementar con el servicio que ella presta.  Eufemia espera incrementar sus ingresos para mantener un ahorro que lo pueda utilizar en los años que su edad y las complicaciones de salud que esto conlleva ya no le permitan trabajar.
texts.en:
Just a little while ago, the southern part of the city of Quito was no considered one of the economic strongholds of the Ecuadorian capital. Now this area is an economic force in the city. There are enterprising families in this place that have fought to stand out. There are natives and migrants from other cities and countries, and it has been a meeting point for people from various provinces. It has extensive streets. 

Eufemia lives in the Chimbacalle area, in Ferroviaria Baja, a neighborhood located in the southern part of the city, an area with a lot of commercial activity that keeps growing and greatly contributes to the economic growth of the city. The parks with their large green areas stand out in this zone. Families go to them on weekends. There is access to all kinds of services and its inhabitants are entrepreneurs who take advantage of every opportunity that presents itself when it comes to setting up new businesses. Migrants from various provinces of the country live here and they put their skills to the test to move forward by setting up businesses, most of which are established through experience. 

Eufemia, 60, is a hard-working woman who has never stopped fighting to achieve her dreams. She finished high school and then started working, because the economic situation in her household did not permit her to study further. While young, she married and had three sons who are now grown: Edison, 42, Patricio, 40, and Juan Carlos, 32. Eufemia is now divorced and lives alone, but she believes that she can move forward regardless of her situation. The proof of this is that four years ago, she opened a small place in which she sells traditional fast foods, which were in high demand by the students, residents, and workers in the area. This activity has helped to give her economic stability and she can also enjoy free time with her relatives. 

For eight hours a day, Eufemia cleans the foods, prepares them and attends to each one of her customers. Now with the experience she has gained, she is sure she will be able to grow her business, which is why she went to Fundación Alternativa through Kiva. They give her a loan so that she can buy merchandise like sweets and goods for immediate consumption that can complement or be combined with the services that she provides. Eufemia hopes to increase her income to maintain some savings that she can use when her age and the health complications that come with it no longer permit her to work.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing sweets and offering them to her customers

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
La Sra Mirian es una mujer valerosa llena de virtudes, ella se define como una persona humilde  de corazon noble y muy trabajadora que todo lo hace por el amor a sus dos hijos a los cuales inculca valores como la honradez, la responsabilidad, la humildad y el trabajo, es por esto que sus hijos la aman y sus vecinos la respetan por todo el sacrificio que ella hace para sacar a su familia adelante.

El credito solicitado a Fodemi es para la invertir en su pequeño local en la compra de un nuevo horno para sus bizcochos, y con lo que sobre de dinero, en la compra de materia prima como manteca, queso, huevos y harina, elementos indispensables para la realizacion de unos delicios bizcochos.

Para Mirian el sueño que se a propuesto cumplir en el tener una cafeteria grande donde ella pueda hacer sus bizcochos y los pueda vender dentro de su propio local, y con esto mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y brindarles una buena educacion para que en un futuro sean unos excelentes profesionales donde su madre se sienta orgullosa de ellos.
texts.en:
Mirian is a brave woman of many virtues, who defines herself as a humble person with a noble heart and who works very hard for the deep love she has for her two children, to whom she teaches values such as honesty, responsibility, humbleness and hard work. Her children love her for this and her neighbors respect her for the sacrifices she makes to provide for her family.

The loans she has requested to Fodemi will be used to invest in her small activity by buying a new oven to bake her biscuits, as well as in purchasing basic ingredients such as butter, cheese, eggs and flour, all essential items she needs to prepare her delicious biscuits.

Mirian’s dream is to own a big café where she can make her biscuits to then sell them in her own locale. This would allow her to improve her children’s standard of living and to grant them a good education that in the future will help them become good professionals she can be proud of.

loans.use: To buy a new oven, butter, cheese, eggs and flour.

loans.name: Jose's Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario esta conformado por tres personas,que se definen como personas de corazon noble y muy trabajadores que todo lo hacen por el amor a su familia.

Don Jose es un hombre de caracter fuerte, muy trabajador que todo su esfuerzo es por el amor a su familia. para Jose lo principal es la honradez, la responsabilidad, la humildad y estos valores los entrega a sus hijos para que sean unas buenas personas, es por esto que su comunidad lo aprecian y le respetan por todo el sacrificio que hace para sacar a su familia adelante.

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi es para la invertir en la compra de semilla de cebolla y habas, y en la compra de abono organico ya que tienen el terreno arado y listo para la siembra de estos productos, aumentando la produccion mediante el buen manejo de la agricultura.

Para Jose el sueño que se a propuesto es el comprarse otro terreno, donde pueda sembrar otros cultivos ademas de cebolla, sueña con que sus hijos entren a la universidad y sigan una profesion de agronomia para que ayuden en la agricultura, y dar la educacion a sus hijos para que aprendan a ser unos buenos seres humanos.
texts.en:
This support group is made up of three good-hearted, hardworking people trying to help their families.

Jose, one member, is a man of character, who works very hard powered by the love of his family. It is very important to Jose to teach his children to live with values such as honesty, modesty, and responsibility. His community appreciates these values in him and he is well-respected for the sacrifices he makes to help his family get ahead. Above all, he seeks to teach his children to be good people.

Jose is requesting this loan in order to buy onion and bean seeds, as well as organic fertilizer. His land is already plowed and ready for planting. Jose is an experienced farmer who knows how to get the most out of his land. 

His dream is to buy another plot of land on which he can grow other crops. By doing this, he will be able to pay for his children to go to a university so they can become professionals in the field of agriculture and contribute to the growing knowledge in this area.

loans.use: to buy onion and bean seeds to plant in his plowed land.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene  42 años tiene dos hijos de las edades de 4 y 6  años,  ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de carne de cordero y res, ella vende en su tienda donde también ofrece productos de primera necesidad, su tienda que se encuentra en la zona las Delicias de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  está en su segunda secuencia con la institución, la Sra. María  va a usar este préstamo para la reparación de su vehículo ya que tiene algunas fallas y esto no le permite hacer sus labores cotidianas ya que este es el que le transporta para la compra de sus productos, la Sra. María es una persona muy emprendedora y trabajadora, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien creció en su actividad y mejoro sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Señora Maria is 42 years old. She has two children, ages 4 and 6. She sells a variety of types of beef and lamb meat. She sells in her store, where she also offers basic products. Her store is located in the Delicias zone of the city of Cochabamba. This is her second loan sequence with the institution. Señora Maria is going to use this loan to repair her vehicle, since it has some problems, and this does not allow her to do her daily work, since this [vehicle] is what transports her to buy her products. Señora Maria is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working person. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support offered her, since the previous loan went very well for her. She grew her business and improved her income.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Conejitos Valientes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario esta formado por tres personas, las cuales tienen un fin comun que es el salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
La presidenta de este grupo es la Sra Hilda, ella comenta que es una persona muy amable, solidaria, honrada, muy trabajadora que todos estos valores los enseño sus padres, ella quiere salir adelante y cumplir muchas metas junto a su esposo, estas son las razones por las cuales la Sra Hilda se a sabido ganar el respeto y aprecio de toda su comunidad.
El credito solicitado a Fodemi, es para la compra de conejitos reproductores y para la adecuacion y arreglo de las jaulas, ya que como los conejitos estan creciendo grandes necesitan un mejoramiento en sus jaulas.
El sueño que la Sra Hilda tiene es el tener un terreno grande donde pueda tener conejos, cuyes, pollos, y sacar a vender a su ciudad, ya que esto representa un buen ingreso economico y ayudaria a mejorar sus condiciones ayudando a toda su familia.
texts.en:
This support group is comprised of three people who have the common goal of moving forward and improving their families' living conditions.

The president of the group is Hilda. She says that she is a kind, supportive, honest, and very hard-working person. Her parents taught her all of these values. She wants to move forward and complete her goals along with her spouse. For these reasons, Hilda has been know to gain the respect of everyone in her community. 

This loan requested to Fodemi is to buy breeding rabbits and improve the cage arrangement. Since the rabbits are growing bigger, they need better cages.

Hilda's dream is to have a large piece of land where she can have rabbits, guinea pigs, and chickens, and then take them to sell in the city. This is a good source of income and would help her to improve her conditions and help her whole family.

loans.use: to buy breeding rabbits and improve their cages

loans.name: Ndeye Magatte

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Magatte est une femme mariée  qui exerce l’activité de commerce depuis 6 ans. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de pâte d'arachide   dans la localité ou elle habite. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits qui seront destinés a renforcer son stock. Elle souhaite accroitre la quantité de produits a vendre dans le but d' augmenter le niveau de ses bénéfices pour pouvoir épargner.
texts.en: Ms. Ndeye Magatte is a married woman who has been working in commerce for six years. She is specialized in selling peanut paste in the town were she lives. She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch office and is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for buying products for bolstering her inventory. She would like to increase her sales volume to boost her profits, so she can save money.

loans.use: to buy peanut paste for resale

loans.name: Juventud Unida Group

texts.es: Cordiales Saludos: Este es la Alcancía Comunal  “Juventud Unida”, la cual participan 06 personas dinámicas y responsables que llevan trabajando 04 meses. En la fotografía se puede apreciar a Isabel una de las socias, está ubicada en la parte posterior es la primera del lado izquierdo, viste polo rosado y chaleco rojo. Con los deseos de contar con un negocio propio y brindarles una mejora calidad de vida a sus hijos Isabel inicio su negocio, donde actualmente ofrece productos de primera necesidad. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo a podido mejorar su vivienda y mantener su negocio. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas, y de esta manera tener surtida su tienda. Seguir creciendo en su negocio es su mayor deseo.  Isabel tiene 40 años, es separada con 02 hijos menores de edad. El grupo “Juventud Unida” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito.
texts.en: Cordial Greetings.  This communal bank is “Juventud Unida” (United Youth) and six dynamic, responsible people participate in it; they’ve been working four months.  One of the members, Isabel, appears in the photo in the rear, first from the left, wearing a pink shirt and red vest.  Hoping to have a business of her own and provide a better life for her children, Isabel started her business where she sells basic staples.  With he fruits of her labor she’s been able to make home improvements and stay in business.  Her current loan will be used to buy groceries, beverages and snacks to keep her store well-stocked.  Her greatest wish is to continue to grow in business.  Isabel is 40-years-old, separated and has two minor children.  The “Juventud Unida” group thanks those people who made this loan possible.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, et  en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles polygamiques à NOUMOUSSO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de KADIOLO. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
SITAN, 2ème de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo fait la vente de beurre de karité dans ce groupe de femmes DJANTOYERELA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une douzaine de sacs de 100kg de noix de karité. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants  Kadiolo ville et au grand marché de la ville les jours de foire.
Après transformation des noix en beurre de karité, elle les vend au marché  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.250 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group DJANTOYERELA are married women averaging 44 years of age and five children each. The women live in polygamous families in NOUMOUSSO, a working-class district in Kadiolo City. They are on their seventh loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loans were correctly paid back.
 
SITAN, who is second from the right in the photo, sells shea butter in this group of women. She intends to use her loan to purchase a dozen sacks of shea nuts. She gets her supplies from the villages neighoring Kadiolo City and at the big market in town on market days. After processing the nuts into shea butter, she sells her product for cash to a customer base composed of men and women at the market and at home.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 37,250 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used for repaying the loan and the interest on it, and the other part is for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase shea nuts for making shea butter

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Monsieur Modou, qui est un sociétaire d’un des guichets ruraux de l'IMCEC, est un agriculteur depuis plus de 12 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. C’est un habitué du guichet car il est à son 5èmes crédit. Modou est jeune et s’active afin de pouvoir nourrir sa famille. Il exploite un champ ou il fait de la culture maraichère. Il vient solliciter un crédit afin de pouvoir acheter des tuyaux, du gasoil, de l’engrais et du fumier. Grace aux bénéfices, il peut désormais mettre de l’argent de coté et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille. Etant toujours obligé d’aller chercher les produits ailleurs, Modou veut ouvrir une boutique de vente de semences et de produits d’entretien pour les champs.
texts.en: Monsieur Modou, who is a client of one of UIMCEC's rural offices, has been a farmer for over twelve years. He is a married father. He is a regular, as this is his fifth loan. Modou is young and works hard to feed his family. He has a field where he grows produce. He is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy piping, fuel oil, manure, and fertilizer. Thanks to the loans, he will now be able to put money aside and improve his family's nutrition. Because he always has to go looking for products elsewhere, Modou wants to open a seed and farm supply store.

loans.use: to buy fuel oil, manure, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Veronica Esmeralda

texts.es: Verónica de 33 años de edad vive juntos  a su familia, su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos es una mujer luchadora con altas visiones que en la vida solo le ha importado brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos ya que cuando estos crezcan vean el esfuerzo que su madre les dio. Verónica felizmente se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales esta agradecida con Dios porque día a día tiene el pan de cada día en su hogar y posee de clientela por su forma y manera de atender confía en que jamás de tener la vida que tiene. Verónica necesita comprar más materiales para su venta es por eso que decidió acercase a INTEGRAL  y comprar: Maíz, azúcar, pollo, frijol, sal entre otros. Buscar tener los mejores productos para mantener activa su tienda y así brindarles lo mejor a sus clientes. Agradece a Dios porque siente que la ayuda pronto llegara y seguirá siendo un ejemplo para su familia y quienes la admiran.
texts.en:
Veronica is 33 years old and lives together with her family; her husband, and their two young children. She is a determined woman with high hopes. The most important thing in her life is to give her best to her children so that when they grow up they can see their mother's efforts. 

Veronica earns a living happily making and selling tamales. She is grateful to God for being able to provide daily bread for her family and have a regular clientele. Thanks to the good service she provides, she is certain that her life will continue to be as good as it is today.

Because Veronica needs to buy more materials in order to sell, she decided to reach out to INTEGRAL and buy: corn, sugar, chicken, beans, and salt, among other things. She wants to have the best products to keep her shop in business and to provide her clients with the best. She thanks God because she knows that the help will soon arrive and she will continue to be an example for her family and for those that admire her.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, chicken, beans, and salt, among other things.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth sells ladies' clothing and cosmetics at Whindo near Takoradi. 

Ruth has received a junior high school education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a commercial driver. 

Ruth has been selling ladies' clothing and cosmetics for the past two years. She is responsible for supporting her husband in taking care of the child and other family expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy more women's clothing and cosmetics for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more women's clothing and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en:
Eldaniz is very hardworking and friendly man of 32 years. He is married and an IDP (internally displaced person). 

Eldaniz raises cattle and has seven years of experience in this field. He gets financial support from the government as an IDP, but it is too low to cover his family's needs. 

Eldaniz usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them in five to six months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Meat selling brings 100 AZN of income per month. People use beef in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. 

This is the only financial income in his family and not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. 

Eldaniz applied for 1,800 AZN to purchase four calves and one milk cow.

loans.use: to buy four calves and one milk cow.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 31 years old and married. She has two children, both in school. Jessica works very hard to provide for them.

Jessica runs a sari-sari or general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack foods, sardines and other groceries. 

Jessica requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school through college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has three children. She has never had any formal education. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Mary is operating a grocery shop at Whindo near Takoradi with provisions like milo, milk, canned drinks and bread. She has been in this business for the past five years. Mary uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the family. 

She will use her loan to buy more groceries to increase goods in the store to satisfy her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in the business to expand it more.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell.

loans.name: Rakibu

texts.en:
Rakibu is a 50-year-old married man with seven children living in Kagadi, Uganda.

For four years now he has been dealing in local brew and with the income earned he has bought land and also paid school fees for his children. He is also a farmer who was inspired in this activity by the ready market for agricultural products and the low cost of production.

Unpredictable weather changes and high license fees are his major hardships, while his dream is to export the local brew and venture into modern farming methods.

Rakibu intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes sells ladies' and children’s wear and fruits at Whindo near Takoradi. 

Agnes has no educational background. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. 

Agnes has been selling ladies' and children’s wear and fruits for the past four years. She is responsible for helping her husband in taking care of the family. 

Agnes will use her loan to buy more ladies' and children’s wear and fruits. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to enable her to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: to buy more ladies' and children’s wear and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: This time, for her 4th loan, Margarita is borrowing Php 13,000 to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.  The basket weaving business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues and provides her and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 38-year-old married man with five children aged between 14 and 6 living in Kagadi Uganda. Due to his passion for agriculture he started a produce business three years ago. He has been able to build rental houses to supplement his produce business and also has continued to do farming. He dreams of building a residential house for his growing family. Weather and bad roads affect his business. Julius is requesting a loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Association Dental 15 Group

texts.fr: "L'association Dental 15 " se compose de cinq femmes.Elles sont toutes mariées et mères de familles. Elles exercent un commerce de produits divers ( tissus, produits cosmétiques...).Ce commerce leur permet de subvenir aux besoins alimentaires, sanitaires et d'entretien de leurs familles.Le chef de groupe Mame Nobo, qui tient le carnet au milieu du groupe, est mère de quatre enfants.Elle vend des tissus "thioub" qu'elle place auprès de ses clients à crédit. Elle parvient avec ses revenus à subvenir aux dépenses familiales. Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter des tissus et des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
The Dental 15 group is made up of five women. They are all married and have children. They sell various products (fabric, cosmetic products, etc.) Their business allows them to cover their expenses for food, health, and other family-related needs.

The group leader, Mame Nobo (the woman holding the notebook in the photo), has four children. She sells "thioub" fabric for credit to her customers. She is able to support her family with the revenue that she earns.

The group is seeking a loan of 500,000f in order to strengthen their business and to buy fabric and cosmetic products.

loans.use: to buy fabric and cosmetic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fattening feed

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана - предприниматель с стажем. Она уже давно торгует качественной женской одеждой. Лучше всего продаются нижнее белье, носки, колготки. Она сама ездит за товаром в Белоруссию (соседнюю с Украиной страну), где делает закупку товара. В этот раз Светлане также нужен кредит для поездки за товаром. У Светланы - много постоянных клиентов, что обеспечивает ей хороший сбыт и успех в бизнесе.
texts.en: Svetlana is a businesswoman with experience. She has been selling quality women's clothing for a long time. The best selling items are underwear, socks and stockings. She travels to Belarus to buy merchandise herself (a neighboring country to Ukraine) where she buys the items. This time Svetlana needs a loan to travel to buy merchandise. She has many regular customers who help her make good sales and success in her business.

loans.use: to make a wholesale purchase of merchandise - stockings, underwear, sock and etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas and water to sell.

loans.name: Qurban

texts.en:
Qurban is a 34-year-old man, an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and three sons. He is a farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 8 years. During these years Qurban gained enough skills and experience  to run the business. He chose this crop business because it  is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy; many national dishes made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan families and they also make fresh punch. Qurban usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Qurban wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1700 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian sells footwear and fruits at Whindo near Takoradi. Her educational background is up to the junior high school level. She is single and has no children. 

Over the past year, Vivian has been in the business of selling footwear and fruit. She is responsible for supporting her parents. Her loan will be used to buy more footwear and fruit, especially apples and oranges. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand it.

loans.use: buy more footwear and fruit, especially apples and oranges.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells ladies dresses and bags at Whindo near Takoradi. She has completed  junior high school. She is single and without children. Mary has been selling ladies wear and bags for 2 years now. She is responsible for taking care of herself and her aged parents. Her loan will be used to buy more ladies wear and bags for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand it.

loans.use: buy more ladies wear and bags for sale.

loans.name: Heydar

texts.en:
Heydar, 33, is married with three children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products and provides beef to local butchers. Heydar has 6 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him them how best to look after cattle. He receives 80 AZN financial support from government each month, but this is too low to cover his family's needs.

Heydar usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them at a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. He sells milk and yogurt he sells to his neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings in 150 AZN per month. Milk and yogurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yogurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and common in everyday life.  
 
This is only one income in his family, and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Heydar applied for 1800 AZN to purchase one milk cow and three cattle. He is a trustworthy client and this will be his fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow and three cattle.

loans.name: Tongre Group

texts.fr:
Mme TOYIOU IVETTE est responsable du  groupe TONGRE. Mariée, elle est mère de  (03) enfants. Le plus âgé a 08ans et le moins âgés à 04moins. 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle à 04 personnes  en charge.

Mme vend de patte d’arachide, atiéké (couscous de manioc) et frites  depuis 04ans.  Elle s’approvisionne à Pô et à Sitarail (gare du train). Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter  01 sac d’arachide, quelques Sachets d’atiéké (couscous de manioc), 10 régimes de banane plantain (Aloco) et de la patate pour les frites.

Elle veut  épargner ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne ouvrir un maquis restaurant  et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Toyiou Ivette is the leader of the group Tongre. Married, she is the mother of 3 children. The oldest is 8 years old and the youngest is 4 months old. Two children go to school and she has 4 dependents.

Toyiou Ivette has been selling peanut butter, atiéké [couscous made from manioc] and fries for 4 years. She gets her supplies in Pô and Sitarail (train station). Her customers are men and women.

She wants to buy herself 1 bag of peanuts, several packages of atiéké [couscous made from manioc], 10 bunches of plantain bananas (Aloco) and potatoes for the fries.

She wants to save her profits. Toyiou Ivette has the ambition of opening a restaurant and supporting her husband with the family responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy herself 1 bag of peanuts, several packages of atiéké [couscous made from manioc], 10 bunches of plantain bananas (Aloco) and potatoes for the fries.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana is a 32-year-old married woman from Al Karak, Jordan. She is requesting a 500 JOD loan to buy materials to create flower arrangements to sell to her friends and neighbors. She will also use her loan to increase her product offerings. In the future, Rana hopes to expand her business and open a shop to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy materials to create flower arrangements

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BENKADI  est constitué de 2 femmes veuves  et 3 mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait la restauration et la vente de céréales.
BAYO, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la femme assise dans la photo. Elle fait l’achat et  vente de céréales et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 sacs de 100 kg de fonio avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is composed of 2 widows and 3 married women, who average 36 years old and have, on average, four children. They live in traditional families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the town of Bougouni. They know each other from neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. 

To increase their financial capacity in order to better conduct their business, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their second loan. The previous loan was repaid on time. 

This group of women are in the restaurant business and in the selling of cereals.

Bayo, who is the president of the group, is the women seated in the photo. She sells cereals. With her loan, she hopes to buy two 100 kilogram sacs of fonio [a type of millet] from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales at a market and from home, in cash and credit to customers, who are women and men. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA, which will be invested in their businesses and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Daina

texts.en:
Daina is married and has two children.  Her husband is a carpenter.  She sells provisions and spicy ingredients such as onions, garlic, and meat at  Whindo near Takoradi, which she has been doing for one year. Daina has attained a junior high school education.  

Daina is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more provisions to increase her stock to satisfy her customers. She is responsible for supporting her husband in taking care of their children. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to increase stock.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is divorced and has one child.  She sells cooked rice at Whindo near Takoradi, which she has been doing for one year. She is responsible for taking care of her child and herself. 

Esther is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more sacks of rice so that she can cook and sell to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 47 years old, married, and has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years. 

Soledad is requesting her second loan from NWTF for 26,000 PHP, which she will use to buy grocery items such as snack foods, sardines, shampoo, and other miscellaneous items.  Soledad hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as snack foods, sardines, shampoo, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 38 years old, married, and has five children.  He lives in Kagadi, Uganda. Due to his passion to have a better life, he started a produce business 10 years ago. He has been able to build rental houses to supplement his produce business and has continued to farm. 

Robert is requesting a loan, which he will use to  buy beans and maize to sell.  Weather and bad roads affect his business. He dreams of educating his children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married and has 2 children. She has no formal educational background. Gladys sells rice and other foodstuffs like plantains at Whindo near Takoradi, something she has been doing for the past 3 years. Her husband is a carpenter. With her income, Gladys assists her husband in taking care of their children and other family issues. 

She will use the loan to buy more rice and other foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys plans to use profits to expand the size of her store.

loans.use: buy more rice and other foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 36-year-old government employee who works as a primary school teacher. A father to seven children, he is married and lives in Kagadi Uganda. He has been in this profession for 12 years. He was inspired to the teaching profession by his desire to associate with young people. He has a retail shop to supplement his meager salary. Joseph intends to use the loan to buy soap, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 56-year-old woman, an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is divorced and lives with her parents. She is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. She chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch.

Fatma sells her crop in the central bazaar. Her monthly income is 110 Azerbaijanian Manats (AZN). Her father helps her to sell her crop.

As these products are in high demand, Fatma wants to expand business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose she applied for 1500 AZN. She will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be her third loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sandryani

texts.en:
Sandryani is a 36-year-old single lady who is living with her family. She has been running a business as a seamstress (i.e., blouse, pants, skirt, suits of clothes, and window curtains as well) for 6 years. This business enables her to cover their daily needs.

At the moment, she plans to expand the service by adding a new hemming machine, which can assist her to complete customer's orders on time. She also wants to buy more thread and needles but she does not have capital to do so. Therefore she requested a loan from TLM of 3,000,000 Rupiahs (IDR). She is hoping that the loan would bring a little improvement on her business income.

loans.use: to buy a new hemming machine

loans.name: Orpa

texts.en:
Orpa is 23 years old and single. She is studying at one of the local universities. Orpa’s family has a business of renting a car. Unfortunately, her parents cannot manage the business well, so Orpan took it over to generate more income for her family.
 
Orpa currently needs to repair the car as there are some parts that need to be changed, such as the tires and the carburetor. She is requesting a loan from TLM for 5,000,000 IDR, which she will use to buy the parts needed to repair the car.  This business can positively impact her family income, especially in covering her education fees.

loans.use: to buy some spare parts.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 32-year-old government employee who works as a primary school teacher. A father to three children, he is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been in this profession for 8 years. He was inspired to the teaching profession by his desire to teach. He has a produce business to supplement the low pay from his salary and has a plan of building rental houses to earn an extra income. John intends to use the loan to buy cement and iron sheets to complete his commercial house.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron sheets to complete his commercial house.

loans.name: Mariatou

texts.fr:
Madame Mariatou est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants résidant chez son époux dans une famille nucléaire à Hamdallaye Extension,  dans la ville de  Sikasso.
Madame  Mariatou après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée il maintenant 7 ans à la fabrique des savons traditionnels. Elle mène son activité dans son domicile conjugal de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’une année et a déjà bénéficié d’un premier prêt qui fut correctement remboursé. Elle est à son deuxième prêt qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de roulement afin d’acheter des matières premières nécessaires à la fabrication de savon traditionnels et ensuite de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa  clientèle.
Elle compte acheter avec ce  nouveau prêt, 5 futs d’huile de coton, 5 futs de déchets d’huile de coton (appelé pâte noire), 2 sacs de soude caustique, 2 paquets de parfums et 2 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe. Elle acheté ses matières premières sur place et à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso et vend ses produits en détail; au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes de sa localité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mariatou is 38 years old, married and the mother of 6 children living with her husband in a nuclear family in Hamdallaye Extension, in the town of Sikasso.

After having managed many businesses without success, Mariatou started making traditional soap 7 years ago now. She manages her business in her marital home in Sikasso where she is in much demand by her clientèle because of the quality of her products. To satisfy her clientèle which is growing more and more, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than a year ago and has already benefited from a first loan which was correctly reimbursed. She is on her second loan which will allow her to increase her working capital in order to buy the raw materials necessary for making traditional soap and then better respond to the expectations of her clientèle.

With this new loan she plans to buy 5 cans of cotton oil, 5 cans of waste from cotton oil (called black paste), 2 bags of caustic soda, 2 packages of perfumes and 2 cartloads of firewood. She buys her raw materials locally and in Bobo Dioulasso (republic of Burkina Faso) and sells her products retail, for cash and credit to a clientèle generally made up of women from her village.

With this loan she envisions making a monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA which will be used to strengthen her business, contribute to the family expenses and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make traditional soap.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is married and has children.  He is a hard-working, enterprising person, who wants to move forward day by day. He and his family live in Likoni, in Coast province.  Augustine has a grocery store, which he has had for four years. 

Augustine is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy products for his store such as salt, sugar, rice, soft drinks, and snacks.  This loan will enable him to give good service to his customers and get new customers, so that his store will be well-known in the area.  It will also help him earn a good income, which he will use to support his family's household expenses.  Augustine's dream is to have a mini-mart and look for alternatives for generating a good income in order to pay for his children's schooling and support his wife.

loans.use: to purchase products such as salt, sugar, rice, soft drinks, and snacks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a hairdresser at Whindo near Takoradi. Elizabeth has received National Vocational and Technical (NVTI) certification. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a carpenter by profession. Elizabeth has been a hairdresser for the past 2 years. She assists her husband with family needs as part of her responsibilities. Her loan will be used to buy more hair products for her work. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to recruit more workers.

loans.use: to buy more hair products for her work.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has four children. Both Ali and his wife provide for the family.

Ali owns a bakery. He established his business in 2010, and now he has two employees. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. He is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD to renovate and to expand his bakery. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate and expand his bakery

loans.name: Ridwan

texts.en:
Ridwan is a 27-year-old motor-taxi driver, who is married to Yeni, 27. They are blessed with Ade, 2 and Elo, an 11-month-old baby. 

Ridwan bought a motorbike in installments to assist him to earn money for his family. At the moment, Ridwan still has to repay the installment for 5 months- amounting to 680,000 IDR/month.
 
The income earned from the business was spent to repay the installment so Ridwan could not meet his family's needs properly. Ridwan was thinking to pay off the installment; therefore he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to 6,000,000 IDR. He is optimistic that his income would be able to repay a loan from TLM and meet his family's needs as well.

loans.use: to pay off the motorbike installment

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en:
Yohana is a 25-year-old widow who is living with her daughter Lony, 4. Since her husband passed away last year, Yohana then automatically took over responsibility as a breadwinner for her family’s living.

Yohana initiated a kiosk business as her income source. Currently, Yohana was thinking to improve her business by adding more products. Therefore, she requested a loan from TLM of 7,500,000 IDR. She planned to spend the loan on soap, sugar, instant noodles, two jars to place types of cake and a display cupboard.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, instant noodles, two jars to place types of cake and a display cupboard.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 30 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She lives in Jacob Town. Mamie has a table at the community market where she sells peppers, rice, vita (a juice drink), onions, and palm oil, which she has been doing for eight years. 

Marnie is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more rice, palm oil, peppers, vita, and onions for her business. She is proud of her business because she makes a profit when she sells. She will use some of the profit to help with the educational expenses of her children and buy goods to improve the business.  In the future, Marnie hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, palm oil, peppers, vita, and onions,

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth  is married and has six children. She has received no formal education. Elizabeth sells oil, fish and slippers at Whindo near Takoradi. She has been in this business for the past eight years. Her husband is a farmer. Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband in providing food for their family. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase food items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to buy more products for sale.

loans.use: to purchase food items to sell

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia  sells provisions and footwear at Whindo near Takoradi. Cecelia has received no formal education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Cecelia has been selling provisions and footwear for some months now. As part of her responsibilities she helps her husband to take care of their children. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries and footwear. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more groceries and footwear.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem, 39 years old and a married guy, is the father of a 15-year-old daughter and 13-year-old triplets. 

To be able to support the family he opened a small fruit and vegetable shop where he brings in his goods directly from farms or the main market for fruits and vegetables. Now Saleem has applied for this loan in order to increase the quantity he gets from the market to increase his profits.

loans.use: to increase the quantity he has of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary  sells groceries at Whindo near Takoradi. Mary has received no formal education.  She is married and has three children with her husband who is a commercial driver. She has been in this business for the past two years. She is responsible for assisting her husband in taking care of the family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries to satisfy her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Ms Shahida is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been running a nursery business (plant sale outlet) with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Shahida’s husband. They have been doing it together for the last seven years.  She started her business with just a few plants to sell but as the time passed, she has made progress in her business and now enjoys a regular list of customers. 

Shahida is a mother of two children who also assist them in their business. Her husband is very happy with the support and cooperation provided to him in the business. For the growth of fresh flowers and plants, Shahida has applied a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase more seeds of different flowers and plants and packs of insecticides and pesticides. She has been in association with Kashf for five years. She has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues on the expansion of her business and part for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds of different flowers and plants and packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Rabeha

texts.en:
Rabeha is 56 years old and has five children. One of her daughters is a media student at the university. She chose this major to reflect her strong personality and curiosity. 

Rabeha is requesting a loan, which she will use to support her daughter in her studies and pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Erkingul

texts.ru: Эркингуль 38 лет, замужем. Эркингуль воспитала 3 детей. Дети Эркингуль все учатся в школе, они все очень веселые и умные. Муж активно помогает по хозяйству. Эркингуль имеет высшее образование, она по специальности бухгалтер,аудитор. На сегодняшний день она работает в станции по снабжении электричеством местного населения, бухгалтером.  В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, Эркингуль занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 16,000 сом (KGS) 14 лет назад, сегодня хозяйство приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS).  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эркингуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 бычков. Они планируют откормить бычков в течении 5-6 месяцев и затем продать. В планах у Эркингуль на вырученные средства от данного проекта приобрести автомобиль, это их давняя  с мужем мечта.
texts.en:
Erkingul is 38 years old, married, and raising three children. Her children, cheerful and smart, all attend school.  Her husband actively helps her with the housework. 

Erkingul has a higher education degree, and she is trained as an accountant / auditor. She is currently working as an accountant for a plant that supplies electricity to the local population.  However, the main source of income for Erkingul's family is her animal husbandry and farming business. She started this activity 14 years ago, with an initial capital of 16,000 som (KGS).  Her business now brings 7,000 som (KGS) per month.  

Eager to further expand her business, Erkingul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners, and requested a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of five young bulls.  She is planning to fatten them for five to six months and then resell them.  Erkingul and her husband have always dreamed of owning a car.

loans.use: to purchase five young bulls.

loans.name: Rokiatou

texts.fr:
Rokiatou est née vers 1991 à Niéna. Elle est célibataire sans enfant résidant chez sa sœur dans une famille nucléaire à Hamdallaye  un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso.
Rokiatou mène il y a environ trois 3 ans une activité d’achat et de vente de chaussures en  plastique, balaies, savons en poudre, etc.  Elle mène son activité à domicile et de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décide de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter  150 paires de chaussures en plastiques de qualités différentes, 5 cartons de savon en poudre et 4 balles de balaies. Elle achète ses marchandises en Côte D’Ivoire et à Bobo Dioulasso au Burkina Faso avant de les revendre en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Rokiatou was born around 1991 in Niéna. She is single, without children, and lives with her sister in a nuclear family in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso.

For about 3 years Rokiatou has been managing a business buying and selling plastic shoes, brooms, powdered soaps, etc. She manages her business from home and as a travelling saleswoman in the town of Sikasso where she is much requested by her clientèle because of the quality of her products. To satisfy her clientèle which is growing more and more, she decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with which she is on her first individual loan.

She plans to buy 150 pairs of plastic shoes made from different quality plastics, 5 cartons of powdered soap and 4 bales of brooms. She buys her merchandise on the Ivory Coast and in Bobo Dioulasso in Burkina Faso before reselling it retail for cash and credit to a clientèle mostly made up of women.

With this loan she envisions making a monthly profit of 85,000 FCFA which will be used to contribute to the family expenses, pay the interest on her loan and invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy 150 pairs of plastic shoes made from different quality plastics, 5 cartons of powdered soap and 4 bales of brooms.

loans.name: Ayebadje

texts.fr: Célibataire sans enfant, Ayébadje est revendeuse de mèches, tissages et produits cosmétiques à son domicile. Âgée de 23 ans, elle a démarré cette activité en 2010 et cherche à améliorer son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille. Dans cette même dynamique, elle désire acheter des produits cosmétiques, mèches et tissages  pour renforcer sa marchandise. Pour cela, elle sollicite son premier crédit auprès de WAGES. Elle compte réinvestir ses profits pour développer son activité.
texts.en: Single and without children, Ayébadje is a reseller of hair extensions, weaves and cosmetic products from her home. Twenty-three years old, she started this business in 2010 and is looking to improve her level of life and that of her family. Along the same lines, she wants to buy cosmetic products, hair extensions and weaves to strengthen her merchandise. In order to do this she is requesting her first loan from WAGES. She plans to reinvest her profits to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products, hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 37 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She lives in Jacob Town in a community called Peace Island. Rebecca has a table in her community where she sells peppers, vita (a juice drink), palm oil, cooking oil, salt, tomatoes, onions, and rice, which she has been doing for nine years. She received the initial capital from her husband to start her business and learned to sell from her mother. 

Rebecca is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more palm oil, rice, onions, and vita to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, rice, onions, and vita.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells foodstuffs like fish, plantains, garden eggs (type of eggplant), and onions at Whindo near Takoradi. Ama has received no formal education.  She is married and has eight children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been selling foodstuffs for five years. She is responsible for helping her husband take care of their children. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs like plantains and vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more plantains and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has three children. Her husband is a storekeeper. Sarah has received no formal education.  She owns a grocery shop and sells foodstuffs at Whindo near Takoradi, which she has been doing for three years. Sarah is responsible for assisting her husband in taking care of their children. 

Sarah is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more provisions and other food items to sell. She hopes to use the profits to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama, a married mother of four with no formal education, is a food vendor who has been selling rice and kenkey in Whindo near Takoradi for the past four years. Married to a commercial driver, she uses her income to help her husband take care of their children.

Ama will use this loan to purchase rice for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice for resale.

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
Ilgar is a 42-year-old married father with two children. He has been in the products sale business for 5 years. In order to improve his business and increase his monthly income, Ilgar is requesting a loan of 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy some new products (tea,flour,butter, milk, etc.) for his shop.

Ilgar is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city, but now lives and works in Fizuli region with his family.

loans.use: to buy inventory of products for his shop

loans.name: Chynarkul

texts.ru: Чынаркул 45 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Чынаркул в качестве дополнительного дохода  3 года назад начала занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 13,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Чынаркул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коров, 1 бычок, 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 5,000 сом.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи, а также заготовку кормов на зиму. Доходы от кредита Чынаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы иметь возможность построить небольшую времянку.
texts.en:
Chynarkul is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children. As a source of supplementary income, 3 years ago Chynarkul began raising livestock and cultivating crops. She started her business with a sum of 13,000 som. Thanks to her hard work, Chynarkul's herd currently includes 2 dairy cows, 1 calf, and 15 sheep and goats. Her business' monthly profits amount to roughly 5,000 som.

In order to continue developing her business, Chynarkul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for fattening and resale, and also to stock up on animal feed for the winter. Chynarkul plans to invest her profits from this loan into further increasing the size of her herd, and into constructing a small temporary animal shelter.

loans.use: to purchase cows and sheep

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гулзат 24 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Гулзат начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с 30,000 сом (KGS) в 2007 году, хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. Благодаря упорному труду Гулзат, ее хозяйство насчитывает 3 коровы,15 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец по более низкой цене. Доходы Гулзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнес за счет увеличения поголовья скота. В её планах в будущем построить дом.
texts.en:
Gulzat is 24 years old, married and has three children. In search of a source of income for the family, Gulzat started working with livestock breeding. Having started with 30,000 som (KGS) in 2007, the farm today brings in around 20,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy products and reselling livestock. Thanks to Gulzat's persistent work, her farm today counts three cows and 15 sheep. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulzat turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep at a very low price. Gulzat plans to invest the income in further growing her business through increasing the amount of livestock. She plans to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Youssouf

texts.fr:
Né vers  Novembre 1976 à Kati, Monsieur  Youssouf est marié et père d’un enfant. Il réside avec sa famille dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Hamdallaye, Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Youssouf après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié  il y a plus de trois 3 années à l’achat vente d’huiles pour moteur, d’essences et de gas-oil avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ quelque mois et est à son premier prêt individuel.
Ainsi, avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 50 litres d’huile pour moteur, 100 litres d’essence et 50 litres de gas- oil. Il s’approvisionne auprès des stations services grossistes de place avant de les revendre en détail, au  comptant et à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce premier crédit un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de roulement, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born around November 1976 in Kati, Youssouf is married and father to one child. He lives with his family in a large traditional family in Hamdallaye, Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

After having managed several businesses without success, Youssouf started to buy and sell motor oils, gas and gas-oil more than 3 years ago to a clientèle made up of all sectors of society. He is much requested by his clientèle because of the quality of his products. To satisfy his clientèle which is growing more and more, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about several months ago and is on his first individual loan.

Thus, with this first loan, he plans to buy 50 liters of motor oil, 100 liters of gas and 50 liters of gas-oil. He gets his supplies from the local wholesale service stations before reselling them retail, for cash and credit.

With this first loan he envisions making an average monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA which will be used to increase his working capital, contribute to the family expenses and pay the interest on his loan.

loans.use: to buy 50 liters of motor oil, 100 liters of gas and 50 liters of gas-oil.

loans.name: Dametote

texts.fr: Revendeur de prêt à porter et de chaussures depuis 2007, Dametote vend aussi des pintades par saison. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants tous scolarisés. Âgée de 33 ans, il gère sa propre affaire mais ne dispose pas encore de lieu fixe. L’ainée a 08 ans et le dernier a 05 ans.  Il sollicite son cinquième  crédit auprès de WAGES pour l’achat des marchandises. Il  désire épargner ses profits et agrandir son activité pour mieux couvrir les besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Reseller of ready to wear outfits and shoes since 2007, Dametote also sells guinea fowl seasonally. He is married and father to 2 children who all go to school. Thirty-three years old, he manages his own business but does not yet have a fixed location. His oldest is 8 years old and his youngest is 5 years old. He is requesting his fifth loan from WAGES to buy merchandise. He wants to save his profits and expand his business to better cover the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and outfits.

loans.name: Holali

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés, Holali  est revendeuse de tonneaux vides. Elle est âgée de 31 ans et son premier enfant est âgé de 16 ans tandis que le dernier a 04 ans. Elle dispose d’un étalage devant sa maison et pratique cette activité depuis 2007. Confrontée à un problème de fonds de commerce et de concurrence, elle  sollicite son troisième prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter de la marchandise. Elle veut faire prospérer son activité  mais aussi avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Married and mother to 3 children of whom 2 go to school, Holali is a reseller of empty barrels. She is 31 years old and her first child is 16 years old while the last is 4 years old. She has a display in front of her house and has been in this business since 2007. Confronted by a problem with business and competition, she is requesting a third loan from WAGES in order to buy merchandise. She wants to make her business prosper but also have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy barrels.

loans.name: Ghofran

texts.en: Ghofran is 21 years old, single and lives with her sister and three brothers. In order to support her parents and the rest of her family, she started a tailoring and knitting business at home, where she makes wool blouses, dresses and shirts. Ghofran is applying for a youth loan to improve her business by purchasing a new sewing machine as well as some knitting tools and supplies.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has two children.  Her husband is a contractor.  She sells bananas, pineapples, and oranges at Whindo near Takoradi, which she has been doing for two years. Lucy has received no formal education. She is responsible for assisting her husband in taking care of their children. 

Lucy is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more fruits to sell. She hopes to use the profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Bazar

texts.ru: Базар проживает в районе Яван. Он несколько раз кредитуется в нашей организации. Очередной заем, он берет для своего магазина, а также для посева сельскохозяйственных культур. Так как на сегодняшний день в свободное время Базар занимается посевом зернобобовых культур. Он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и покупки продуктов питания.
texts.en: Bazar lives in the Yavan region of Tajikistan. He has already taken several loans from MLO Humo & Partners. Bazar is taking his next loan for the benefit of his store, but also for sowing crops, as presently he spends his free time cultivating legumes. He will use this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers, as well as food products.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and food products

loans.name: Amgalanbaatar

texts.en:
Amgalanbaatar is 39 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in a ger in the Sukhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Oktyabr works at private company as a janitor. His son Gansuh is 19 years old and is a university student, his daughter Gantuya and son Ganzorig are 16 and 13 years old and are secondary school students. 

Amgalanbaatar has been working in private company as welding specialist. He is planning to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas hybrid car to reduce his transportation cost. He is now requesting 6,460,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly car to provide taxi service during his off-duty time in order to increase family income since they already have one student studying in university and next year his daughter is going to enroll university. He is a diligent, hardworking and responsible person.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas hybrid car to provide taxi service during his off-duty time

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Mr. Batbayar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in their house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife, Bolormaa, helps her husband to run an agriculture business. His two sons, Purevjargal and Purevbat, are secondary school students and his four-year-old daughter, Bayarmaa, goes to kindergarten. Batbayar has been running his business of growing organic vegetables since 2005. He and his wife plant, grow and harvest organic vegetables and sell it to local customers at the local market. He and his wife have harvested a lot of organic vegetables that they plan to sell during the winter and spring months. Batbayar is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to build a storage pit to store his organic vegetables. The storage pit will keep the vegetables fresh for selling during the winter. Batbayar is a diligent, honest and hardworking person.

loans.use: to build a storage pit to store his organic vegetables.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina  is a seamstress. She also sells sandals at her shop at Whindo, near Takoradi. Augustina has a senior high school level education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. 

Augustina has been a seamstress for the past ten years. As part of her responsibilities, she sews and buys dresses for the family. Her loan will be used to buy more fabrics for her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to recruit more apprentices and teach them.

loans.use: buy more fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary earns a living by operating a chop bar (or stand where a variety of African dishes are sold). She also sells eggs in the town of Whindo. She is married to a carpenter and the mother of five children, but has no formal education. Mary has been in her current line of work for two years, and is committed to help her husband provide for their family. She will use this loan buy more food stuffs and ingredients so that she can continue to cook for her customers. She plans to use the additional profits she earns to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to cook food for her customers.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo en el negocio de la venta de frutas y verduras, se comprara manzanas, peras, uvas, papas, güisquiles, y otros frutos que le sean demandados para continuar vendiendo a sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, manteniendo el negocio, con las ganancias ha podido ayudar a su familia con su alimentación diaria, ella continuara realizando sus ventas y apoyando a sus hijos en el estudio.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan because she needs to buy more stock for her fruit and vegetable selling business. She will buy apples, pears, grapes, potatoes, chayotes, and other fruits that are in demand to continue selling to her customers. 

The previous loan had a positive effect as it allowed her to keep her business going. With her earnings, she has been able to contribute towards the family's daily food costs. She will continue her sales, and she will continue supporting her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like apples, pears, grapes, potatoes, and chayotes to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa sells groceries at Whindo near Takoradi. Theresa completed junior high school. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a contractor. She has been in this business for two years now. As part of her responsibilities, she helps her husband in providing food and health care for their children. Her loan will be used to buy more variety of groceries--such as oil, canned fish, and tomatoes--to satisfy her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as oil, canned fish, and tomatoes

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 54-year-old housewife who takes care of her three sons and three daughters, while her husband is working in his electrician business. 

In order to help her husband support their family, she chose to use her skills in making delicious fresh yogurt and cheese into a business that can bring in additional income. 

Now Aisha has applied for this loan to buy a larger quantity of milk to increase her productivity and therefore increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of milk.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married and has eight children with her husband, who is a farmer. She has no formal education.
