Esi is a food vendor at Whindo near Takoradi. She has been in this business for the past 12 years. Esi uses her income to support her husband to take care of the family. 

She will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs and other ingredients to prepare her food to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to expand her food-selling business.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs and other ingredients to prepare her food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a machine for bag stitching.

loans.name: Razan

texts.en: Razan is a 20-year-old lady who has six siblings living in the same house with their parents. Razan is a university student majoring in mathematics; she has chosen this major to combine her passion for numbers and her desire to become a teacher. Now she has applied for this loan to continue with her path and pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Sugran

texts.en:
Ms. Sugran is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. For 10 years, she has been running a business of milk sales.  She serves well in her community; her husband assists her in selling milk door-to-door. According to Sugran, she faced many problems during her early married life. Her husband is a laborer. He was not able to cover the expenses of the family members alone.

Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. She is very much satisfied and requested a repeat loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy another buffalo. She intends to use the profits on her children’s well-being and education.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a 56-year-old housewife looking after her six sons and daughters. Her husband works as a school bus driver, while his wife makes pickles for sale at home besides taking care of her family. 

Yusra uses olives, eggplant, cucumber and other vegetables to make different type of pickles. In order to increase her profits, she decided to apply for this loan to get more food containers and more vegetables.

loans.use: to get more food containers and more vegetables.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en: Raeda is a 42-year-old married woman; she is a mother of five sons and daughters. One of her sons has a mini-market where he sells different types of food products. Raeda sometimes goes to help him in the store. After discussing the needs of the store with her son, she decided to apply for this loan in order to get more goods for the store to help in increasing his profits.

loans.use: to get more goods for the store

loans.name: Rehab

texts.en: Rehab is a 40-year-old mother of two sons. She has a tailoring business that helps in supporting herself and improving their living conditions. Now Rehab has applied for this loan in order to bring in more thread and tools in addition to doing maintenance on her sewing machine.

loans.use: to bring in more thread and tools and do maintenance on her sewing machine.

loans.name: Dukals

texts.en:
Dukals, 44, stopped her education in the sixth grade. She is a mother of six children who are between the ages of 11 and 28. Four of her children live outside the home and are independent, while two of the children live with her at home and are attending school. Dukals lives at Jacob Town in a community called City View. 

For the past two years, she has been selling palm oil in the community market. She makes a profit when she sells. With the profit, she buys more goods to improve the business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more gallons of palm oil to improve the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to improve the business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos los cuales todos están en etapa escolar, viven en una casa alquilada ocupando una habitación pequeña, la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona Mariscal Santa Cruz de la ciudad de La Paz.
 Ella estudio solo hasta terminar la secundaria y actualmente cuenta con una tienda de barrio de la cual percibe ingresos diarios; el crédito lo requiere para aumentar su stock de productos (azúcar, arroz, fideos, sodas, etc.) en su tienda por las fiestas de fin de año para mejorar sus ingresos y también mejorar su calidad de vida ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alquiler, educación y alimentación de su familia.
 El sueño de Ana, es adquirir una casa en anticretico (una forma legal que permite un acuerdo entre el dueño de casa y el arrendatario para vivir en un departamento o habitación por un monto global y por un tiempo no mayor a dos años, al cabo de los cuales el dueño de casa se compromete a devolver el dinero al arrendatario) para ahorrar en los pagos de alquiler y dar más comodidad a su familia.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Ana is single and has four children who are all school age.  They all live in a small, rented, one-bedroom house located in the city of La Paz’s Mariscal Santa Cruz zone.  She only completed secondary school and currently has a neighborhood store that earns daily income.  She needs the loan to increase her stock of merchandise (sugar, rice, noodles, soft-drinks, etc.) in her store for the end-of-year festivities to increase her income and also to improve her quality of life since she’s the only one that covers rental, schooling and food costs for her family.


Ana’s dream is to acquire a house under the ‘Anticrético’ modality (a legal transaction that allows for an agreement between a house owner and a renter to live in a house or department for a global amount and for a period of time no greater than two years at the end of which the house owner must return the money to the renter) so she can save on rental costs and provide more comfort for her family.  This is the first time she’s worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, soft-drinks and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por continuar trabajando con préstamo, porque necesita invertir en mas compra de insumos para cultivar granos básicos, comprando abono y foliares, que los utiliza para que la siembra este prevenida de las plagas.
Él manifiesta que sus ingresos han sido mejor con la utilización de los créditos, aumentando la cosecha, le ha dado la capacidad para comprar alimento y vestuario; su familia y José se encuentran muy bien de salud, han mejorado su economía.
texts.en: Jose has decided to continue to work, using a loan, as he needs to invest in additional supplies in order to grow basic grain; he would purchase fertilizer and plants that he would use to protect the crops from pests. He states that his income has improved as a result of his using loans. The harvest has increased which has allowed him to buy food and clothing. Jose and his family are healthy and have improved their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and plants.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has six children. She sells banku (made out of maize and cassava dough), a food staple eaten with many dishes in Ghana. Her business has been located in Abura for the past eight years. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her income to pay for her children's school fees. Ekua will use the loan to purchase maize and cassava, which is what kenkey and banku are made from. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase maize and cassava for making kenkey and banku

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Janett con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo ha hecho crecer a sus hijos ahora ellos son mayores de edad trabajan y estudian, ella se dedica a la venta de pollo por libra y entero, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien ha estado con ella en momentos difíciles y buenos, su meta ahorita es poner otro establecimiento de pollo en base a las ganancias que obtenga con el primer puesto de pollo para seguir creciendo. Ella solicita este segundo crédito para invertir más en pollo entero, menudo, pechuga y pierna son las piezas más buscadas en esta temporada navideña las ventas son muy buenas, ella desea sacar provecho de eso para seguir prosperando.
texts.en: Janett has raised her children with much effort and hard work.  They are adults now and they work and study.  She sells whole chickens and chicken by the pound.  She can count on her husband’s support who has been with her both in difficult and good times.  Her goal for right now is to open another chicken shop with profits earned from her first chicken stand so that she can continue growing.  She’s requesting this second loan to invest more in whole chickens, giblets, breasts and legs which are the chicken parts in higher demand during the Christmas season and sell very well.  She wants to take advantage of this to continue making progress.

loans.use: to buy whole and cut-up chicken to sell.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
Águeda es casada y tiene un hijo que esta en la universidad, viven en la casa de su cuñado ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella estudio solo hasta terminar la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como empleada en el área de administración en un hotel de la zona sur ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia, también cuenta con los ingresos de su esposo ya que es rentista y percibe un ingreso mensual.
 El crédito lo requiere para el pago de la matricula en la universidad de su hijo ya que el aun no trabaja y el sueño de sus padres es que sea profesional para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Águeda’s married and has a son in university.  They live in her brother-in-law’s house occupying two rooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Achachicala zone.  She only completed secondary school and is now employed in the administration department of a hotel in the southern zone and she must cover her family’s food and basic utilities costs.  She also gets help from her husband’s income; he’s retired and earns a monthly pension.  She needs the loan to pay for her son’s university tuition fees because he doesn’t work yet and his parents’ dream is that he becomes a professional to have a better quality of life.  This is the second time she’s asked for an IMPRO and KIVA loan.

loans.use: to pay her son's university semester tuition.

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
María, trabaja en la venta de frutas, vive con su familia, trabajando por llevar lo necesario, considera que a través del negocio ha logrado ayudar en lo más básico, ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de jícamas, papayas, uvas, entre otras que sean necesarias para el movimiento del negocio.
Ella manifiesta que esta ayuda incrementara su negocio, comprando las frutas de temporada, en su familia aspira crecer con los préstamos.
texts.en: María works selling fruit.  She lives with her family and works to provide what’s needed.  She believes that she’s managed to attain the basics by means of her business.  She’s asking for a loan to buy jicama [a tuber], papaya and grapes among others needed for her business.  She states that this help will increase her business buying seasonal fruit; her family aims to grow with the loans.

loans.use: to buy jícama, papaya and grapes.

loans.name: Joyceline

texts.en: Joyceline operates a chop bar (a small restaurant on the side of the road) in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. She has received no formal education. She is divorced and has four children. Joyceline has owned her chop bar for quite a few years. She is responsible for taking care of her children (feeding/clothing them, paying their school fees, etc.), as well as taking care of herself. She also pays for other household expenses such as utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients in bulk for the dishes she makes at her chop bar. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to care for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk for the dishes she makes to sell at her small roadside restaurant (chop bar).

loans.name: Fretzie

texts.en:
Fretzie earns a living from her sari-sari store (variety store) business. She lives with her family in Talibon, Bohol. She has been in this business for more than ten years. Fretzie works hard to help  her husband meet the needs of the family. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, chips, snack foods, soap and toiletries. 
Fretzie hopes to make a success of her business and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, chips, snack foods, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Eftikar

texts.en:
Eftikar, a 40-year-old conservative woman who did not want to appear in the picture for religious reasons, asked her oldest daughter to take her place in the photo.

Eftikar is a mother of six daughters and two sons between the ages of 7 and 20 years old. While she is looking after her children, her husband brings food to the table from his work distributing flour. Eftikar has applied for an educational loan to pay for her oldest daughter Hala’s university fees. She is majoring in Banking and Finance.

loans.use: to pay for her oldest daughter’s university fees

loans.name: Mahasin

texts.en: Mahasin, 58 years old, is an illiterate woman. After her husband passed away, she was left to raise a daughter. To be able to do so, she had to start a home business selling food products to bring in income. Now she has applied for this loan to bring more goods to the mini market and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her mini market

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Ms Khalida is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of three children.  She has been running a food selling business with the support of her husband. She cooks and her husband sells to customers. She sells various dishes like rice, vegetables and chicken ‘nihari’ (the ultimate traditional curry, which became popular among the labor class as a regular breakfast item).

She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation five years ago. She is happy with their support and now applied for a loan of Rs 40,000. She intends to combine this loan with her saving to purchase needed ingredients such as stocks of rice, oil and salts and a couple of chairs to accommodate more customers. She shared her dream of improving her business by offering a more comfortable place where her customers can enjoy their delicious meals.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and salts and a couple of chairs to accommodate more customers.

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is a 40-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has four children.

Jerlyn has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for almost 20 years now. This is the source of their income.

Jerlyn is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the boat and to pay for repairs to the boat. She would also like to use the money for the school expenses of her children.

Jerlyn hopes to make her business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy fuel and to pay for the repairs to the boat

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana de 36 años, tiene 3 hijas de 16, 12 y 4 años. Se separó de su esposo hace muchos años. Ella y sus hijos viven juntos en una casa propia ubicada en un caserío agrícola. Ana es una mujer responsable y emprendedora. Su principal actividad es la agricultura. Lleva como 20 años en esa labor y se considera una buena mujer de campo. Gracias a su esfuerzo consiguió ahorrar y comprarse 4 toros, los que crió. Vendió dos de ellos y ahora tiene dos grandes toros los que le sirven para el servicio de “Yuntas” (animales sujetos a una herramienta para el arado). 
“Con mis toros gano de 70 a 100 soles por trabajo de arado, por eso los cuido mucho, son una de mis grandes posesiones”, menciona.
Tenía problemas frecuentes relacionados a la falta de capital, pero con el tiempo y el trabajo con su banco comunal lo está superando. Ahora se esmera en el cultivo de papas, arvejas y flores de gladiolos, por ello requiere de su ayuda para la compra de abono orgánico. Éste es su crédito número 3 con MFP. Se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado en este tiempo, por su parte se siente contenta con su banco comunal “Las Estrellitas”, donde es la presidenta.
Con los 500 soles podrá comprar bolsas de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de arvejas y flores de gladiolos.
texts.en:
Ana, 36, has three daughters who are 16, 12 and 4 years old.  She separated from her husband years ago.  She and her children live together in a house she owns located in an agricultural settlement.  Ana’s a responsible, enterprising woman.  Her main activity is agriculture.  She’s been in this line of work for about 20 years and she considers herself to be a good woman of the fields.  Thanks to her efforts she managed to buy four bulls that she raised.  She sold two of them and now has two big bulls that are used as a yoked team (pair of animals attached to a plow).  “I earn 70 - 100 soles per plowed field with my bulls which is why I take very good care of them; they are one of my greatest possessions,” she mentions.

She used to have frequent problems related to lack of capital but in time and with her work in the communal bank she’s been overcoming them.  She’s now focusing on growing potatoes, peas and gladioli flowers which is why she needs your help to buy organic manure.  This is her third MFP loan and she’s grateful for the support provided at this time.  On her part, she’s happy in her “Las Estrellitas” (The Little Stars) communal bank that she presides.  She will be able to buy sacks of organic manure for the pea and gladioli crops with the 500 soles.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se ha decido por un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de mercadería para que su negocio funcione mejor, invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, jugos, gatorade, boquitas, entre otra mercadería que le sea útil para atender la demanda.
Ella tuvo su experiencia con el préstamo anterior, le permitió tener más fortalecido el negocio, pudiendo comprar a sus hijos la alimentación, ha mejorado su economía con la inversión anterior, por eso espera que este nuevo financiamiento tenga un efecto de mejoría.
texts.en:
María has decided to request a new loan to buy stock in order that her business can operate better. She will invest in the purchase of sodas, juices and snack food, as well as other stock which help her meet demand.

Her experience with the last loan was that she was able to strengthen her business and so buy food for her children. She also improved her economic situation with the last investment. For that reason, she hopes that this new finance will lead to improvements.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, Gatorade and snack food

loans.name: Debora Esi

texts.en: Debora Esi cooks cassava and maize dishes (banku and kenkey) to sell. She serves them with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce, in Abura. She is married and has four dependents. Debora has been in this business for four years.  She uses her income to help her husband with the general support of their children. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku and kenkey for sale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her cassava and maize dishes (banku and kenkey) for sale.

loans.name: Neda'

texts.en: Neda’, a 37-year-old married lady, is the mother of a three-year-old daughter and a two-year-old son. During the day, Neda’ goes to her job at a governmental entity and, after work, she sells blankets and clothes at home, while looking after her kids. Now Neda’ wants to help her husband to improve their living conditions, so she has applied for this loan in order to buy more bed sheets and a new winter collection to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more bed sheets and a new winter collection to sell in her home-based business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, from Talibon, Bohol, is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of five young children. She has been engaged in the fishing business, jointly with her husband, for more than 20 years.
Helen is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and buckets. With this equipment, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.
In the future, Helen hopes to expand her business and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and buckets for her business.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma, a 51-year-old single woman, is living with her brother and sister. To participate in putting food on the table and paying part of the household bills, Basma makes at home decorations and home accessories using wood, beads, or even embroidery. Now Basma has applied for this loan in order to get more materials to make more accessories and increase her productivity.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make accessories for the home

loans.name: Agnes Aba

texts.en: Agnes Aba sells soap and detergents at Nkanbom-Aseke, near Takoradi. Agnes Aba is a trained vocational student.  She is single. Agnes Aba has been selling soaps and detergents for the past two years. She is responsible for helping her parents with their needs. Her loan will be used to buy more powdered soap to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more powdered soap to sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is married and has four children. She is a Form Four leaver. Christiana sells charcoal and fish at Nkabom-Aseke, near Takoradi. She has been in this business for some time now. Her husband is a farmer. Christiana uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of their children and other family issues. 

She will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christiana plans to buy more products.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Adowa

texts.en:
Adowa sells yam, cassava and provisions at Nkabom-Aseke, near Takoradi. Adowa has received a junior high-school education. She is married and has four children with her husband, who is a contractor. 

Adowa has been selling yam, cassava and provisions for the past four years. As part of her responsibilities, she helps in providing food for her family. 

Her loan will be used to purchase yam tubers, cassava, plantain and other food items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase yam tubers, cassava, plantain and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 60 years old and lives in Kutaisi with her 39-year-old son. Marine works as a saleslady at the newspaper stand and gets a small monthly salary. As her income is not enough even for food and everyday expenses, Marine decided to start up a new business. She requested a loan from a local financial institutions to start trading, but without success. Her loan request was rejected because of her low income and insufficient experience in her business. 

However, her loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The program provides start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. These people do not have access to traditional credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

Marine requested a loan to purchase tobacco which she will sell from her stand. Marine plans to increase the turnover in her trade business gradually. This will raise the income of the family, which she will use to improve the family’s living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase tobacco for resale.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora sells rice, oil and fish at Nkanbom-Aseke, near Takoradi. Dora is a junior high-school leaver. She is married and has three children with her husband who is a contractor. Dora has been selling rice, oil and fish for five years. She is responsible for helping her parents with their needs. 

Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice, cooking oil and fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, cooking oil and fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is single and a Senior High-School leaver. Lucy is a caterer by profession; she operates a snack bar where she serves pastries with soft drinks at Nkabom-Aseke, near Takoradi. She has been in the catering  business for about five years. Lucy uses her income to help provide for her parents' needs. 

She intends to use the loan to purchase flour, cooking oil, meat, sugar and drinks to operate her snack  bar. With the new profits from her expanded business, Lucy plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, meat, sugar and drinks to operate her snack  bar.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama, 40, lives in Jacob Town in a community called St. Frances. Mama is very hard working. She sells six days a week, in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She has been selling bread and juice for the past seven years at the nearby community school. She has five children between the ages of 18 and 25. Two of her children are independent and three of them live with her at home and attend school. Her husband is a teacher and he helps her out in this business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour and packs of juice for the business. Her plan for the future is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more flour and packs of juice .

loans.name: Joeann

texts.en:
Joeann runs a sari-sari or variety store business in her place in Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than six years now. She also operates a repair shop for small carpentry tools like handsaws.

Joeann is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, chips and snack foods, soap and shampoo and other items. With this loan, she can attract and serve more customers in her store.

Joeann aims to expand her business in the future so that it will continue to generate revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, chips and snack foods, soap and shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en: Haifa is a 44-year old ambitious woman who looks after her three sons and one daughter. At the same time, she has established a humble beauty salon that brings the family a supportive income. She has applied for this loan today to buy a new hair straightener and more cosmetics as she also sells them in the salon.

loans.use: to buy a new hair straightener and more cosmetics

loans.name: Shorouq

texts.en:
Shorouq is a conservative young lady, she asked her sister who did not mind to take her place in the photo. 

Shorouq is a 19-year-old single lady. She has three older married sisters and brothers, and another two younger single sisters. Shorouq is going to a collage to get a diploma degree that will allow her to get a job as soon as she graduates, therefore helping her family financially. 

She has applied for this loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees so she can pursue her mission.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma de 30 años es una madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a quienes cuida con amor. Ella vive en una casa propia ubicada en un caserío de un distrito agrícola.
Vilma es una mujer esmerada. Su principal actividad es la agricultura. Desde los 17 años ya trabajaba en terrenos de sus padres. Ahora que tiene 2 hijos se hace cargo de 2 parcelas que sus padres le heredaron.
Ella cultiva papas, arvejas, maíz y flores de gladiolos, siendo estos productos los más rentables, por su baja inversión y por la demanda, según menciona.
“El trabajo es cansado, especialmente en las siembras y cosechas, por eso contrato personal y les pago por cada día”, dice.
Este año sus principales productos que cosechó fueron las papas y arvejas, pero está vez quiere extender sus cultivos de maíz y gladiolos, por eso requiere de su ayuda para adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes orgánicos. Éste es su crédito número 2 con MFP. Se siente contenta de trabajar con un grupo de personas conocidas y confiables. Su banco comunal se llama “Las Estrellitas” y el va bien en el trabajo interno.
Con los 700 soles solicitados podrá comprar 5 bolsas de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Vilma is 30 years old and is a single mother. She has two children whom she loves and takes care of. She lives in her own house, located in a settlement in an agricultural district.

Vilma is a conscientious woman. Her main work is in agriculture. She has been working on her parents’ land since she was 17. Now that she has two children, she is in charge of two plots of land that she inherited from her parents.

She grows potatoes, peas, corn, and gladioli flowers, and mentions that these are the most profitable products due to the low investments costs and the high demand. “It is tiring work, especially during sowing and harvesting. That’s why I hire workers and pay them per day worked, ” she says.

This year, she mainly grew potatoes and peas, but in the future she wants to extend her crops to include corn and gladioli, and this is why she needs bags of organic fertilizer. This is her second loan with the MFP. She is happy to be working with a group of people that she considers trustworthy. Her communal bank is called “Las Estrellitas” [The Little Stars], and it is working well.

With the 700 soles she is requesting, she will be able to buy five bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy five bags of organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Mujeres De Maiz Group

texts.es:
La señora Josefina  esta casada, tiene 36 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiente 5 hijos de los cuales estudian 3, se dedica al comercio a la atención a una tienda quie tiene, que inicio con un poco de capital y que hasta ahora lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la sastrería.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que ser utilizado para la compra de producto para tienda, entre ellos aguas gaseosa, jugos, golosinas, lácteos, cereales, embutidos, etc. Espera tener un negocio siempre con clientes y con productos necesarios para su comunidad. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la sastrería, la confección de diferentes tipos de prendas.
texts.en: Josefina is 36 years old. She is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom are studying. She was not given the opportunity to study. Josefina has a store which she set up with a little capital; she has now been in business for 8 years. Her husband, who is a tailor, supports her in this endeavor. She has set up a group in order to request a loan that will be used to purchase goods for the store - such as sparkling water, juices, candy, dairy products, cereals, charcuterie, etc. She hopes to always have a business to offer clients from her community the products they need. The other members of the group are tailors and make a variety of garments.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her store

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
El señor Abel tiene 45 años de edad, Está casado y tiene 02 hijos que dependen de el, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de helados en las comunidades aledaña a su casa.
Don Abel realiza la venta de los helados en  forma ambulante y se transporta  en su motocicleta, que compro con la ayuda de los préstamos que Prisma le ha otorgado.
Don Abel radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras  y está solicitando el préstamo para compra de paletas rellenas, conos, y cremas de chocolate, vainilla y fresa, ya  que  en esta comunidad el clima siempre es cálido este producto se vende bastante.
Don Abel con el apoyo de este crédito podrá salir adelante con su negocio y mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y tendrá más producto que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Don Abel su sueño  es construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2012.
texts.en:
Sr. Abel is 45 years old, married, and has two dependent children. For the past 10 years, he has managed a business in which he sells frozen treats in the surrounding communities near his home.

Don Abel sells ice cream as a street vendor and transports his products by motorcycle. He purchases his goods with the help of the loans that Prisma has provided. Don Abel lives in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy filled popsicles, cones, and frozen custards (including chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry). Abel sells plenty of these products since the weather in his community is always warm.

With the help of this loan, Don Abel will be able to move forward with his business and gradually improve his quality of life. He will also have more products to offer to his customers. His dream is to build a house and improve his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2012.

loans.use: to buy filled popsicles, cones, and frozen custards of different flavors.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a quite hardworking and talented 28-year-old single woman. Her father is a government employee; his income, however, is not sufficient to meet all the household expenditures, so for the past eight years she has been running a beauty parlor to help support the needs of her family members and provide quality education to her siblings.

Shazia needs to purchase more cosmetics such as packs of makeup kits, cleansers and hair treatment products, so she has requested a loan of Rs 30000 from Kashf Foundation. This will be her third loan cycle, and she has an excellent repayment history. With this assistance, Shazia hopes to boost her net income.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics including packs of makeup kits, cleansers, and hair treatment products

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 34-year-old conservative woman, so she asked her husband Abdullah, who is also her partner, to take her place in the photo. 

Iman and Abdullah help each other by taking shifts in their mini-market from which they support their family and pay their household bills. They have two daughters and one son. Now Iman has applied for this loan to bring in some missing products that have been requested by their customers.

loans.use: to bring in some missing products.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen, is 26 years old. A married lady, her husband is a plumber while she is a housewife. She chose to start a small retail business at home to kill her boredom and make an additional income. She started by buying glass home pieces and appliances and reselling them again to friends and neighbors at a higher price as she brings her products from a wholesale market and free zone areas. 

Now Nisreen has applied for this youth loan to increase the quantity of products she has.

loans.use: to increase the quantity she has of products.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys  is a fishmonger at Nkanbom-Aseke, near Takoradi. Gladys is a primary school leaver. She is single and has three children. She has been selling fish for five years now. She is responsible for helping her parents with their physical needs. 

Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke  for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anatoli

texts.en:
Anatoli is 44 years old and lives in the Kutisi district with his wife and 23-year-old daughter. The only source of income for the family is the small salary earned by Anatoli’s daughter working as a saleslady at the electronic store. Anatoli used to have an auto body repair but the business stopped because of financial problems. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Anatoli has decided to start a new business to supplement his income but his loan requests have been rejected several times by local financial institutions. He lacks experience with new business start-ups and does not qualify under income requirements. Anatoli is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program envisions providing start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to many credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Anatoli will use his loan to re-start a tin auto body repair. He will renovate the workshop where he will set up the auto repair.  Anatoli will provide services to local community members and hopes to increase the monthly income of the family. His new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to renovate the workshop and set up an auto repair.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Ms Razia is a 47-year-old married woman. She took the initiative to run a business making shoes 10 years ago with her three sons. One of her sons is shown in the photo sitting with Razia. She started her business at a very small level and wanted to expand to earn more profit. In order to get the desired business productivity, she told a Kashf foundation business development officer about her business expansion and she was able to access quality micro-finance services that played an integral role in her business productivity.This is her fifth year with Kashf foundation. Now her business has grown to a satisfactory level. She needs a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase more soles, leather and plastic leather to meet the customers’ demands. She expects a boost in her net income through her large sales.

loans.use: to purchase more soles, leather and plastic leather to meet the customers’ demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys sells smoked fish at Nkanbom-Aseke, near Takoradi. Gladys has received a junior high school education. She is married and has two children with her husband, who is a contractor. Gladys has been selling fish for three years now. She is responsible for assisting her husband in taking care of their children. Her loan will be used to acquire large quantities of smoked fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more products.

loans.use: to acquire large quantities of smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Lodigario

texts.en:
Lodigario is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of his income.
Lodigario needs a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. With this, he will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.
Lodigario dreams of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en:
Areej is 27 years old and a single, conservative lady. She asked her younger brother to take her place in the photo. 
After her father passed away, she started a small home business to help support the family. Areej now sells clothing items in addition to some cosmetics products at home. She applied for a youth loan to increase her stock of cosmetics products and increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics products.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is married and has three children. She has received a primary school education and sells polythene bags at Nkanbom-Aseke, near Takoradi. She has been in this business for the past five years. Her husband is a contractor. Comfort uses her income to help her husband keep up the house and support their family. Comfort will use the loan to buy polythene bags and look into other ventures to increase sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to venture into other business.

loans.use: to buy polythene bags and look into other ventures to increase sales.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: El Bosque Group

texts.es: “El Bosque” es un grupo integrado por siete mujeres que se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales y están solicitando su crédito para comprar más animales desde pequeños para que puedan crecerlos engordarlos para después venderlos como por ejemplo Doña Rosa Aurelia, Maricela, Catalina compraran borregos, mientras que Isabel comprara becerros, Areli invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes y Silvia invertirá en bonetería y mercería. Doña Lilia quien es la representante del grupo tiene 43 años de edad esta casada con el señor Moisés desde hace 24 años tuvieron hijos pero actualmente ninguno depende de ellos. Doña Lilia se dedica a la elaboración de costuras desde hace 4 años y platica que inició porque le llamaba la atención ver terminada algunas prendas como faldas, pantalones, blusas etc. Esta vez esta solicitando el crédito para comprar mas tela de diferentes tipos pero también comprara hilos. Doña Lilia que para ella era una muy buena actividad porque era una manera de poder obtener mas ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Doña Lilia comento “Me gustaría llegar a tener un taller de costura mas grande donde pudiéramos trabajar mas personas y así dar trabajo a otras personas, aunque me hacen falta varias maquinas para poder cumplir mi meta y las maquinas están muy caras”. Sin Embargo. Doña Lilia y el resto del grupo esta muy agradecidas con VisioFund y Kiva porque han ayudado a levantar sus actividades productivas.
texts.en:
“El Bosque” ["The Forest"] is a group comprising seven women who rear and sell animals. They are requesting this loan to buy more young animals so that they can rear and fatten them, and later sell them. For example, Rosa Aurelia, Maricela, Catalina bought lambs, while Isabel bought calves. Areli will invest in her grocery store, and Silvia will invest in sewing supplies and haberdashery. 

Lilia, who is the group’s representative, is 43 years old and has been married to Moisés for 24 years. They have children, but at present none of them depend on their parents. Lilia has been working in embroidery for the last 4 years. She says that she started this business because she noticed when items of clothing such as skirts, trousers and blouses, etc. had been finished with embroidery. 

This time she is requesting a loan to buy different types of fabrics, but also to buy thread. Lilia considers it to be a very good activity because it is a way to earn a better income to improve her family’s quality of life. Lilia said “Eventually I would like to have a bigger workshop where more people could work and in that way give work to other people, although I need several sewing machines in order to fulfil this aim and the machines are very dear”. However, Lilia and the rest of the group are very grateful to VisioFund and Kiva because they have helped them to set up their productive activities.”

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, yarn, etc.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan es una persona muy alegre que siempre ha tratado de ser muy resposnsable en cuanto a su trabajo. Él tiene 34 años de edad y esta casado con la señora Ángeles desde hace 14 años; juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos los cuales van a la escuela. Don Juan tiene una carpintería donde realiza muebles para el hogar como puertas, escaleras, colocadores, bromeando comentó "Puedo hacer cualquier cosa, desde palillos hasta el arca de Noe". Esta vez Don Juan esta solicitando el crédito para comprar madera, triplay, tablas, herrajes entre otras cosas. Don Juan platica que inicio su negocio por necesidad ya que el trabajaba anteriormente en una carpinteria fue asi como aprendio pero le gustaba mucho que decidio iniciar su propio negocio, cuenta que no tiene dificultades solo que hay dias en las que les hace falta un poco mas de dinero para poder conseguir su material pero gracias al credito le ayudara mucho para sacar algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes, La meta de Don Juan es llegar a tener un local mas grande donde tenga mas herramientas y mas material para trabajar con las ganacias que obtega podra solventar los gastos de la educacion de sus hijos para que ellos puedan terminar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Juan’s a very cheerful person who has always tried to be very responsible with his work.  He’s 34-years-old and married to Ángeles for 14 years.  They have a family of four children who go to school.  Juan has a carpentry shop where he manufactures home furnishings like doors, stairs, and shelving.  He kiddingly says: “I can make anything from toothpicks to Noah’s ark.”  

On this occasion, Juan is asking for a loan to buy lumber, plywood, boards, iron fittings, etc.  Juan relates that he started his business because of need since he used to work at a carpentry shop and this is how he learned and liked it very much so decided to start his own business.  He relates that he has no difficulties except that there are days when he needs a bit more money to be able to get materials.  But thanks to the loan it will help him much to fill some pending orders he has.  Juan’s goal is to eventually have a larger space with more tools and materials to work with the profits he earns so that he can pay for his children’s education so that they can finish professional careers.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

location.town: San Juan Jalpa, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru: Любовь - пенсионерка. У нее трое взрослых детей, у которых есть свои семьи. Пока Любовь работала, она жила в достатке. Сейчас, на пенсии, ей труднее справляться с финансовыми потребностями. Тем не менее, Любовь смогла отложить часть денег, чтобы сделать ремонт в своей квартире - положить кафельную плитку, поклеить обои, утеплить балкон, пр. Любви нужен кредит, чтобы закончить начатый ремонт. Любовь надеется, что по окончании ремонта дети с внуками будут чаще приходить к ней в гости.
texts.en: Lubov is retired.  She has three adult children who have their own families.  While Lubov worked she lived with plenty.  Now, in retirement, it is more difficult for her to deal with financial needs.  Nonetheless, Lubov was able to put away part of her money in order to make repairs to her apartment - put in tile, put up wallpaper, insulate the balcony, etc.  Lubov needs a loan in order to finish the started repairs.  Lubov hopes that after the repairs are finished her children and grandchildren will visit her more often.

loans.use: to improve her living conditions

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru: Лариса - пенсионерка. Ее дети уже вырости и она живет одна. Помимо пенсии, она имеет дополнителный заработок - занимается художественной вышивкой. Лариса хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия - купить новую кухонную плиту, а также отремонтировать пол в кухне и коридоре.
texts.en: Larisa is retired.  Her children are grown and she lives alone.  In addition to her pension she has an additional income - she does embroidery.  Larisa would like to improve her living conditions - purchase new tile for the kitchen and repair the floor in the kitchen and hallway.

loans.use: to improve her living conditions

loans.name: El Atardecer Group

texts.es: "El Atardecer" es un grupo que lleva varios ciclos trabajando con la institución aunque poco a poco ha aumentado el número de integrantes. Los integrantes comentan que eligieron dicho nombre pues tardaban mucho en decidirlo cuando empezó a atardecer y alguien finalmente propuso el nombre. Francisca quien es una integrante del grupo, comúnmente conocida como Mary, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada con el señor Gustavo desde hace 20 años y han formado una familia con dos hijas una de ellas se encuentra aun estudiando una carrera universitaria. La señora Mary tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 15 años  y la inicio porque quería ayudar con los gastos del hogar, Doña Mary comenta “Inicié vendiendo afuera de mi casa dulces solo en una mesita chica donde ponía diferentes tipos de dulces pero poco a poco fui vendiendo más productos como huevo, leche, pan etc. Estos productos los compraban las señoras y con los dulces me iba muy bien ya que cada vez que pasaban los niños me compraban, con el tiempo decidimos poner un local ya mejor establecido y gracias al crédito he podido levantarla poco a poco”. Esta vez la señora Mary esta solicitando el crédito para poder abastecer su tienda de abarrotes ya que con el crédito otorgado podrá comprar mas leche, huevo, pan, aceite, frijoles, lentejas,  etc. Aunque una de las dificultades de Doña Mary es la falta de dinero para poder seguir invirtiendo más en su tienda de abarrotes porque muchas veces se le termina muy rápido su mercancía y mas los productos que se consumen. A pesar de las dificultades que tiene que superar Mary, su sueño es que su pequeña tienda pueda llegar a convertirse en un gran súper porque aí podrá solventar los gastos de la educación de su hija Bianca para que pueda terminar su carrera en comunicación. Así como Mary, también los demás integrantes tienen sus actividades: Inés también invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes, Víctor y Eva invertirán en borregos, Mónica y Maricela invertirán en la venta de ropa, Graciela invertirá en dulces y finalmente Ángeles invertirá para en su recicladora. Todo el grupo está muy contento y agradecido por los éxitos obtenidos en su familia y en sus negocios gracias al crédito que VisionFund y Kiva les otorga.
texts.en:
The “El Atardecer” (Dusk) group has been working with the institution for several loan cycles, although it has gradually increased the number of members. The members say that they chose this name, as they were taking a very long time in deciding it when it began to get dark, and someone proposed the name. 

Francisca is a member of the group, and is commonly known as Mary. She is 40 years old, and has been married to Gustavo for 20 years. They have created a family, with two daughters; one of them still at university. Mary has had a grocery store for 15 years, and started it because she wanted to help with the household expenses. 

Mary says, "I started selling candy outside my home, just at a small table where I put various types of candy, but gradually I started selling more products such as eggs, milk, bread, etc. The ladies bought these products, and the candy sales were going well, as each time the children passed by they would buy. With time, we decided to set up a shop, now better established, and thanks to the loan, I have been able to build it up little by little."  

This time, Mary is requesting the loan so that she can stock her grocery store, as with the loan she has been granted she will be able to buy more milk, eggs, bread,  cooking oil, beans, lentils, etc. One of Mary's difficulties is lack of money to be able to continue investing more in her grocery store, because many times the merchandise runs out very quickly, especially the products used daily. 

In spite of the difficulties Mary has to overcome, her dream is that her small store can eventually become a large minimart. That way she will be able to cover her daughter Bianca's education expenses, so that she can finish her degree in communications. 

Along with Mary, the other group members also have their activities: Inés will also invest in her grocery store, Victor and Eva will invest in shhep, Mónica and Maricela will invest in the sale of clothing, Graciela will invest in candy, and finally, Ángeles will invest in her recycling center.

The entire group is very happy and grateful for the successes obtained in their families and businesses, thanks to the credit that VisionFund and Kiva grant them.

loans.use: To buy milk, eggs, bread, cooking oil, beans and lentils for her grocery store.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 23 años y nació en Quibdó, capital del Chocó, en el pacífico colombiano. Para poder pagar sus estudios de Licenciado en Inglés y Francés en la universidad, trabajó primero como ayudante en una tienda de abarrotes, luego fue vigilante privado, y por último pizzero en un restaurante de comidas rápidas.  Su padre falleció cuando tenía 15 años, y su madre trabaja como empleada doméstica. Actualmente vive con ella y sus 4 hermanos menores.

Aquí está su historia:

En Colombia se vive una gran paradoja: somos el segundo país más rico en flora y fauna, y poseemos minerales en gran cantidad, pero contamos con los índices de pobreza más altos de toda Latinoamérica, y los niveles de rendimiento escolar más bajo. Es así como se evidencia la poca pertinencia de la educación en esta región. 
Mi madre siempre me ha recalcado: “No importa lo mucho que sepas, si no lo pones al servicio de quien lo necesita,” y es por eso que creo que realizar una Maestría en Políticas y Administración de la Educación no tendría ningún sentido, sino es puesta con fines de mejorar las condiciones educativas que hoy en día se viven en mi pueblo natal, Chocó y Colombia. Precisamente, en mi concepto, existe una educación pertinente, cuando esta se encarga de explotar todas las habilidades y realidades que los habitantes de una región tienen, y direccionarlas al desarrollo de esa región. 

En mi regreso a Colombia, me veo generando nuevas políticas educativas, que se direccionen a una educación más pertinente, y que se enfoque en las necesidades regionales, antes que copiar un modelo extranjero que no se acople a nuestras realidades, promoviendo así el aprovechamiento de nuestras fortalezas.

Siempre que he querido hacer algo, he podido, y ser beneficiario de Kiva probaría una vez más que cuando hay un anhelo, siempre surgirá un camino. Y aunque el camino y trabajo que tengo delante de mí, es aún largo y difícil, me rendiré solo cuando mi último aliento haya emanado de mi ser, puesto que, a fin de cuentas, “el triunfo pertenece a los que se esfuerzan”.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 23, was born in Quibdó, capital of El Chocó, on the Colombian Pacific coast.  To pay for his Bachelor degree in English and French in the university he worked first as an assistant in a grocery store, then as a private watchman and finally as a pizza cook at a fast-food restaurant.  His father died when he was 15-years-old and his mother works as a domestic employee.  He currently lives with her and his four younger siblings.  This is his story:

A great paradox is lived in Colombia: we are the second-richest country in flora and fauna and we possess minerals in great amounts but we have one of the highest poverty indexes in all Latin America and educational outcomes are among the lowest which show how little pertinence education has in this region.

My mother has always stressed: “It’s not important how much you know if you don’t put it to use serving those most in need,” and this is why I believe that getting a Master’s in Education Policy and Administration would make no sense if not aimed at improving the educational conditions existent today in my place of birth, in Chocó and in Colombia.  In my understanding, a pertinent education does exist when it’s aimed at exploiting all the abilities and realities the residents in a region have and directing them towards that region’s development.

At my return to Colombia, I see myself generating new educational policies that will be aimed at a more pertinent education that will be focused on regional needs rather than on copies of foreign models that do not adjust to our own realities thus promoting the use of our strengths.

Whenever I’ve wanted to do something, I’ve been able to and being a Kiva beneficiary would prove once more that where there’s a will a path will always appear.  And even though the road and the work I have before me is long and hard, I will only give up when my last breath leaves my being because in the final analysis, “victory belongs to those who make the effort.”

loans.use: to buy a computer and pay application fees for a Masters in Education Administration.

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.ru: Руслала работает учителем искусства в школе. Ей 22 года. Скоро у Русланы радостное событие - свадьба. После свадьбы Руслана с мужем будут жить в ее доме, который достался ей в наследство от бабушки. Руслана просит предоставить ей кредит для ремонта этого дома. Часть ремонта Руслана уже сделала сама со своих сбережений. Ей осталось поменять двери, и отремонтировать полы.
texts.en: Ruslana works as an art teacher at a school.  She is 22 years old.  Soon Ruslana will have a happy occasion - her wedding.  After the wedding Ruslana and her husband will live in her house which she inherited from her grandmother.  Ruslana is asking for a loan to repair her home.  Ruslana has already done some of the repairs herself using her savings.  She still has to change the door and repair the floor.

loans.use: to improve her living conditions - change her doors and floor

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
Yessica es otro de los miembros del grupo San Isidro, ella tiene 27 años, solo estudio la preparatoria y es madre soltera de un pequeño niño, Yessica platica que  siempre había trabajado para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar pero ahora que se ha convertido en madre tiene que buscar la manera de ganar un poco mas de dinero para brindarle a su hijo una vida de calidad y que en un futuro tenga la oportunidad de estudiar así que con el apoyo de su familia ha iniciado a trabajar en su propio negocio. Yessica tiene un pequeño cyber café en su hogar; ella esta muy contenta no solo porque tiene su negocio sino porque con su cyber esta brindando un servicio a muchos jovenes ya que su comunidad se encuentra un poco retirada y no se tenia acceso  a este tipo de servicio. Ella nos comenta que tiene dos meses con su negocio y gracias a Dios ha iniciado a hacer poco a poco clientes, también nos platica que en algunas ocasiones tiene que enseñar a algunos de sus clientes a usar este servicio pero lo hace con mucho gusto ya que sabe que esto ayudara a que mas gente asista a su negocio. Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de hojas blancas tinta y dar mantenimiento a su equipo de cómputo. Yessica espera que a futuro poder invertir en la compra de más equipos para agrandar su negocio.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Rumualda siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar,
Susana siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar,
Abrahan venta de abarrotes,
Lourdes venta de pollo,
Laudelina siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar,
Martimiana venta de fertilizantes 
Liliana venta de pollo 
Lorenzo siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar,
Francisca venta de ropa
Bertha siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar,
texts.en:
Yessica, who is a member of the San Isidro Group, is 27 years old. She studied through preparatory school level and is a single mother with a small son. Yessica notes that she has always worked to help her parents with household expenses. Now that she has become a mother, of course, she had to search for a way to earn a little more money in order to offer her son a quality life and, in the future, a chance to study. Therefore, with the help of her family, she began to work in her own business. Yessica has established a small cyber cafe in her home.

Yessica is very content, not just because she has her own business, but because through her cyber cafe, she is offering a service to many young people whose community is somewhat remote and who lack access to this type of service. She says that, thank God, with just 2 months in business, little by little, customers have begun to appear. She also notes that sometimes she has to teach some of customers to use the service but she does so with much pleasure, knowing that this will help attract more people to use her business. 

She will invest this loan in purchasing printer paper, cartridges, and in the maintenance of computer equipment. Yessica hopes to be able to purchase more equipment in the future in order to expand her business.

The remaining Group members [and their activities] are:

Rumualda sows and cultivates sugar cane
Susana sows and cultivates sugar cane
Abrahan sells groceries
Lourdes sells chicken
Laudelina sows and cultivates sugar cane
Martimiana sells fertilizers
Liliana sells chicken
Lorenzo sows and cultivates sugar cane
Francisca sells clothing
Bertha sows and cultivates sugar cane

loans.use: to buy printer paper and ink cartrages, and to perform maintenance on computer equipment in her internet cafe.

location.town: La Tabaquera,Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El Amanecer es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 5 mujeres alegres y emprendedoras cada una de ella 
desarrolla una actividad económica: Arcenia tiene una estética, Luz Elena venta de cosméticos, Laura venta de zapatos, Maricruz venta de cosméticos y Victoria venta de abarrotes. Este grupo esta ubicado en una región cañera, donde la principal fuente de empleo esta en el campo en la siembra y cultivo de caña de Azúcar.

Doña Arcenia tiene la edad de 47 años, estudió la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor Jorge con el cual 
tiene tres hijos. Ella platica que durante muchos años había querido tener una fuente de empleo propia para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hasta que un día decidió tomar un curso de belleza en el cual aprendió a cortar el cabello y aplicar tintes, después de este curso puso su propia estética la cual actualmente se encuentra ubicada en el centro de su comunidad. Ella ya tiene 9 años realizando esta actividad y ha sabido mantenerse en el gusto de sus clientes ya que siempre que tiene oportunidad toma mas cursos para actualizarse. Ella esta muy contenta ya que se siente independiente y ha dado a sus hijos la oportunidad de continuar con sus estudios. Arcenia invertirá este crédito en la compra de tintes, tijeras, gel, cera, navajas, brochas, guantes, secadora para cabello, esmaltes y maquinas de rasurar. En un futuro le gustaría que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales y hacer una pequeña remodelación a su negocio.
texts.en:
The name of this group, composed of five joyful and enterprising women, is "El Amanecer". Each one has her own line of work: Arcenia has a beauty salon, Luz Elena sells cosmetics, Laura sells shoes, Maricruz sells cosmetics and Victoria sells groceries. They are located in a sugar cane region, where planting and growing sugar cane is the main source of jobs.

Mrs. Arcenia is 47 years old, she went to high school and she is married to Mr. Jorge. They have three kids together. She says that she wanted to have a source of income in order to help her husband with the home expenses, and one day she decided to start a course in beauty treatments. She learned to do haircuts and dye, and she opened her own beauty salon located right in the center of her town.

Mrs. Arcenia has been working in this activity for nine years now and she has managed to please her clients because she takes courses every time she can in order to stay up to date. She is happy because she feels that she is independent and that she has managed to give her children the opportunity to continue with their studies.

Arcenia will invest the money from the loan in dyes, scissors, gel, wax, razors, brushes, gloves, a hair dryer, nail polish and clippers.

She would like to see her children graduate and become professionals. She would also like to remodel her establishment.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon, like dyes, scissors, a hair dryer and clippers.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BENKAN  est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Les deux  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de produits cosmétiques et de l’encens avec ROKIA qui est la présidente du groupe  et la seule femme assise dans le groupe. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, diverses matières premières entrant dans la composition de l’encens auprès des grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes après confection de l’encens, au marché  et à domicile, au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The BENKAN group is made up of four married women, who are, on average 26 years old and have four children.  They live in traditional families in the Massablacoura district of the city of Bougouni.

They know each other as neighbors and friends, and through business.  In order to raise their working capital and better conduct their businesses, they have joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their third loan.  The two previous loans have been properly repaid.  This group of women is in the business of selling cosmetic products and incense with ROKIA as the leader of the group.  She is the only woman seated in the group.  With her loan, she plans to buy the main ingredients for making incense from wholesalers in Bamako.   After making the incense, she makes her sales at the market and from home, for cash and on credit, to a clientele of women and men
She foresees making an annual monthly benefit of 60,000 FCFA which will be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make incense.

loans.name: Gilson

texts.en: Gilson has plenty of knowledge and experience working with marble and granite. He started his own business five years ago in the hopes of becoming financially stable.  Now his business has become his passion.  He designs, installs, and custom-fabricates kitchen and bathroom counter tops, vanity tops, fireplaces and Jacuzzis for residential and commercial buildings. He works with two contracted employees depending on the demand of work. For Gilson, the most important business traits are honesty and hard work. All of his clients come from previous clients and friends who already trust his work. Gilson is a man who the community trusts.  Gilson wants to keep working hard to expand his business to one day be able to buy his own house. This loan will help him get close to his dream by allowing him to purchase granite and marble and work with larger contractors.  Help Gilson get closer to fulfilling his American Dream of purchasing his own home through the hard work of his small business!

loans.use: To purchase granite and marble

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, de 60 años, es una mujer cordial y emprendedora. Vive en su  casa propia. Sus hijos ya son independientes y viven en otros lugares. El trabajo de Victoria consiste en  diseño, confección  y venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños. Realiza esta actividad en un local en el interior de su vivienda propia. Lleva 40 años en esta actividad. Comenta que se  inicio en esta actividad por la necesidad de conseguir un empleo y como había estudiado confecciones industriales, decidió poner su negocio. Realiza esta actividad económica junto a unas amigas con quienes ha formado una sociedad. Considera rentable porque las empresas solicitan sus servicios para que haga los uniformes de sus obreros, también vende sus mercadería a  sus amigos, familiares y vecinos. Antes de iniciar este negocio su esposo se hacia cargo de los gastos de su hogar, pero la abandono entonces ella decidió seguir adelante y ejercer lo que había estudiado. Espera seguir manteniendo  su negocio porque le brinda  buenas ganancias económicas y puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 1 con la institución MFP, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por darle la oportunidad de pertenecer aun grupo donde se apoyan mutuamente. Esto le motiva seguir siendo puntual en sus cuotas a pagar.
Con el monto solicitado 800 soles comprará materiales como telas, blondas, elásticos, hilos para seguir confeccionando  y completar el numero de pedidos que le hicieron para el mes próximo.
texts.en:
Victoria is 60, and a friendly, enterprising woman. She lives in her own home. Her children are now independent and live in other places. Victoria's work is designing, making and selling clothing for ladies, men and children.

She does this work at a shop inside her own home, and has been doing this for 40 years. She says that she started in this business because of the need to obtain employment, and as she had studied industrial dressmaking, she decided to set up her business. She carries on her livelihood together with a few friends with whom she has formed a partnership. 

She considers it profitable, because the companies request her services for making employee uniforms. She also sells her merchandise to friends, family members and neighbors. Before she started this business, her husband took care of the household expenses, but he left her, so she decided to move forward and and put into practice what she had studied. 

She hopes to keep her business going, because it provides good earnings and she can pay her household expenses. Therefore, this will be her first loan with the MFP institution. She feels very grateful to the institution for giving her the chance to belong to a group where they support one another. This motivates her to continue being on time with her installment payments.

With the amount applied for of 800 soles, she will buy material such as fabric, lace, elastic and thread, so that she can continue making clothing and finish the number of orders placed with her for the coming month.

loans.use: To buy fabric, lace, elastic and thread.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson, being a businessman in Juba, expresses his happiness with the first loan as follows: He has increased his stock, paid his children's school fees, and he is now taking another loan to buy more items like maize flour, wool, paper bags and many others to increase his business and expand as well. Nelson says that he is very happy for the loan given by FSL.

loans.use: to purchase more items like maize flour, wool, paper bags, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.
